author: {'steamid': '76561198072788133', 'num_games_owned': 581, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1518143241}
review:
O jogo tem um visual retrô 16 bits, além de uma jogabilidade simples no estilo turnos, mas ao mesmo tempo muito empolgante. De início, pode parecer um pouco difícil até pegar o jeito da jogabilidade, mas a segunda jogatina já pode ser feita no hard tranquilamente. O fato de ter tradução em português também adiciona um ponto a mais ao jogo, ainda que seja PT-PT. Com certeza vale a compra, principalmente se for em promoção.

PS. Há uma versão pra smartphone idêntica a essa. Vale muito a pena também.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046817400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1506376205}
review:
Quest of Dungeon is exactly what it’s advertised as: a pretty basic dungeon crawler with the standard rpg classes. If you’re looking for something to keep you busy for a few hours every once in awhile this is the game for you. 
Quest of Dungeon doesn’t overcomplicate things like most dungeon crawlers tend to do, everything is straightforward and to the point: you’re in a dungeon, there’s lotsa treasure to find, rooms to explore, monsters to kill and shops to buy from.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981868839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1403, 'last_played': 1478389811}
review: Um pequeno grande jogo. Um simples e divertido rogue-like, em Quest of Dugeons você controla um personagem que deve explorar dungeons geradas aleatoriamente em vários pisos diferentes, enfrentando vários monstros, A diversão fica, além da exploração e das batalhas (que são muito simples e em misto de turnos e ação), por conta do humor do "narrador" e dos loots dos monstros, compostos de armaduras e armas. Ainda rapidamente é possível adquirir as magias para dar uma maior possibilidade de batalha. Jogo muito recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041512403', 'num_games_owned': 1837, 'num_reviews': 2464, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1465541121}
review:
전사, 샤먼, 궁수, 마법사.
4개의 클래스 중 하나를 선택하여 던전을 탐험합니다.
실시간 턴베이스 게임으로, 플레이어가 행동을 하면 몬스터도 행동을 하죠.
몬스터들을 처치하고 아이템을 얻거나 구매하면서 성장.
계단을 이용해서 다음 층으로 이동합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037940027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1501453273}
review:
[h1]Блестяще![/h1]
Игра простая как тапок.
ходи, бей, юзай спеллы. Кушай, выпивай и лечись - в общем, выживай.
Глубина данжа в среднем 6-8 уровней. 5 уровней сложности. 2 офф концепта подземелий от разработчика (как я понял, это компании или эпизоды). Имеется режим самогенерирующегося подземелья.
Инвентарь есть, монстры есть, спеллы в книгах, их надо искать и учить; система торговли, ачивки, боссы, каждый уровень - отдельная стилистика со своими мобами. Ловушки, секреты, телепорты, прокачка, свобода действи и прочее-прочее-прочее...
Все что надо и ничего лишнего.
В общем, имеем самый стабильный и нормальный симулятор данжа из всех.
[h1]Следите за уровнем сложности!!![/h1]
Изначально дается на выбор 4 персонажа со своей (индивидуальной) стилистикой игры: рыцарь-мечник, маг, мили-волшебник и лучник. У каждого свои спеллы, которые необходимо находить по ходу игры. Имеется разблокировать дополнительных персонажей.
Советую самому изучить персонажей, но дам совет новичку: самый простой класс - лучник. стреляет в зоне видимости в любую цель.

Из грехов - сильно устают глаза после 30 минут игры из-за фиксированной камеры (за персонажем)

P.S. Если игра вам показалась слишком легкой - ставьте режим Hell. Лично я померал в самом начале xD

author: {'steamid': '76561197979068807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 343, 'last_played': 1469981955}
review:
Ottimo gioco che si ispira ad alcuni grandi classici come Gauntlet del NES. Il titolo è sicuramente ben riuscito, non un capolavoro certo ma sicuramente un gioco davvero godibile. Grafica carina senza troppe pretese, audio un po' scadente ma comunque appropriato. I 4 eroi sono forse un po' squilibrati, infatti i melee sembrano soffrire moltissimo (almeno all'inizio) mentre i ranged sono subito performanti.

Voto: 7,5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198242420402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1472179011}
review:
Holy smokes this game is addicting!!! I fell in love with it instantly.  It is so simple to play but so addicting.  First night went like this;
Created Fighter; clicked skull sign-died......
Created Fighter; explored dungeon was really happy with progress ran into big monster died....
Created shaman; Was not watching hit points (careless) died...
Created Wizard; Completely engrossed, beat 2 bosses, crushed many levels, ran into boss encounter....died
Realized it was nearly 3 hours later and I had to work :(

author: {'steamid': '76561198072499698', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 212, 'last_played': 1467598645}
review:
This game starts frustrating, the UI isn't very clear, the contorls aren't great, and you will spawn and die several times before really figuring out how to play it.

Then you go down about 5 levels like an invinceable beast, until you run into the first thing strong enough to one shot you.

At the 6th level, there will be a boss. They will one shot you. If they have a ranged attack you're fucked. If you DON'T have a ranged attack and a way to keep distance, you're fucked. Can't recommend this game for that reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111013714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 2011, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2011, 'last_played': 1500079096}
review:
If I am to describe this game, I'd say that Quest of Dungeons is charming in its simplicity. Gameplay is turn based, very laconic and, therefore, easy to get used to, but I think that this game still has enough diversity to keep you entertained. You have four characters (actually five, but the last one is unlocked after you've beaten the game for the first time), and due to unique skills each one of them has from the start and can learn later from the books, they are all different and playable in their own way. The dungeon you are to go through has seven floors with randomly located bosses, and, of course, the final boss in the end, but it is your choice - to thoroughly explore each floor or rush through them as fast as you can. There are also locked doors and locked chests that will require one of five types of key (or even two keys at once!), but some things are designed to make your life easier - like the hidden stashes you can find by just walking through a room, or fountains that can be used once and restore your life or mana. Another classic element - merchants, who can buy treasures you find and sell you potions, keys and armor/weapons. 

Of course, there are minuses. One of them is the quest system - there are only two types of quest, "find something" or "kill the champion version of the regular mob", and doing them is nothing but boring. Another minus is that, for me, the game was pretty easy, even on Hell difficulty. 

Still, overall I found it an enjoyable little piece, and for its price I would recommend it to anyone, even to those who are not familiar with roguelite games. It's simple, it's accessible, it looks cute and it can be great for killing your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198103516073', 'num_games_owned': 204, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 516, 'last_played': 1614484639}

author: {'steamid': '76561198044988535', 'num_games_owned': 1389, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1411782850}
review:
Si vous êtes un fan des vieux gauntlet, si vous aimez les jeux de rôles ou les rogue-like, et que vous ne voulez pas y mettre le paquet financièrement, Quest of Dungeons est parfait pour vous. Au bout d’une dizaine d’heures, vous aurez certainement terminé le jeu plusieurs fois et maîtrisé les différentes techniques nécessaires pour compléter le jeu dans son mode de difficulté le plus élevé… mais pour 5$, vous en aurez suffisamment pour votre argent (2$ si vous achetez le jeu pour votre téléphone mobile). J’ai bien aimé mon expérience avec ce jeu et le recommande à tous les amateurs de jeux de rôles.

POINTS POSITIFS : 
- Ne se prend pas au sérieux, humour subtil et amusant
- Mises à jour constantes pour rendre le jeu meilleur
- Un excellent hommage aux jeux du genre Gauntlet
- Interface de jeu simple à comprendre et à utiliser
- Variété des styles de jeu bien équilibrée
- Offre un bon défi aux vétérans avec le mode enfer
- Style rétro bien réussi

POINTS NÉGATIFS :
- Aucun tutoriel pour enseigner les bases du jeu
- Les premières parties sont impardonnables, courbe de difficulté abrupte
- La progression des personnages en pouvoirs dépend des trésors
- Manque de fluidité dans les animations
- Contrôles peu intuitifs sur ordinateur
- Musique répétitive

SCORE FINAL : 6.9

Critique complète : http://www.lantredugeek.com/quest-of-dungeons-un-bel-hommage-a-gauntlet/

author: {'steamid': '76561198059323912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1464922984}
review: This game is incredibly fun!  A playthrough actually takes a decent amount of time and there is pretty good replay value.  There are a good amount of achievements and class selection that also add variety.  My favorite part of the game is definetly that Hell Mode is very challenging, but still beatable.  This game does a great job of letting you set your own pace while still providing a nice challenge that doesn't take the fun out of the game.  If you see this game on sale or in a bundle, it's definetly worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995427553', 'num_games_owned': 656, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1485698986}
review: Got Bored on the first floor.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993502989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1464053212}
review:
Quest of Dungeons is a fun little time waster. It has its limitations as most indie games do but that said, if you like aimlessly slaughtering things in dungeons then this is for you. It's a small game, quick to download, just as quick to uninstall when you're done.

Not the best game I've ever played, felt like some of the dungeon crawlers from the 90's which is a plus in itself, I really miss those games. But yeah, still worth picking up if you've got time on your hands and you wanna say, "I've played that".

author: {'steamid': '76561197984829179', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1476533721}
review: Lovely pass-time game, also can be quite motivatingly annoying :) Still haven't reached far yet, but I know I'll be coming back to it once in a while, so eventually I will!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051514195', 'num_games_owned': 545, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1550328080}
review:
I love it !

It's a roguelite, turn-based but quick gameplay, like a quick Dremor-lite : enchantments, inventory with items, dungeons-shops, keys, treasures, some jokes and... it manages the ghost of your previous tries :D
Try to beat it ;)

Nice gfx and fun musics !

A good quick turn-based roguelite !

review:
Quest of Dungeons is a game that I recommend because:

author: {'steamid': '76561197963362269', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1459195108}
review:
There seems to be a lot of games that think themselves stylish and cool when they make a "Roguelike" game like this....im here to tell you its not fun or interesting.  This game is as binary and dumbed down as a game can get as far as a dungeon crawler is concerned.  To me it felt more like a game you'd buy on a phone not a Steam game.  

You walk your character into enemies and either they kill you or you kill them....eat what little food you have and if you are unlucky enough to stumble onto a boss room you are pretty much dead no matter what.   Theres no way to close a door or make a boss activate a trap and gain an advantage its either you are stocked up on large heals or you are dead. 

When i think of Roguelike games i expect difficulty but i also want experience and skill to also play a part in how well i do.  This game is almost entirely based on luck and nothing else and it irritates me that you just need to repetedly die until you get the right amount of luck for you to even have a chance of a "good run" to start.

I was looking for a deep fun RPG roguelike and what i got was a tablet game for kids.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008010902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1453965008}
review: I can't even explain why I like this game so much -- it's minimalist and repetitive, but for some reason i feel compelled to continue playing it. Totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11196, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1459084590}
review:
The interface doesn't work properly on a modern system (greater than last decades 1080p format).   The old video/mouse draw issue that occurs when developers don't bother with fancy big budget stuff like "Testing" and "QA", whatever that is.

Technical problems hammer the nail into the coffin of a low effort, derivative RPG ripoff.   It's got retro pixel graphics (art is hard, don't try!  Mediocrity will still get sales!), 2D overhead gameplay (the 1980's called, want their video gaming technology back, etc). 

Basically a typical low effort indy cash grab with no compelling gameplay draws.   You'd be better off playing any one of the free MMOs on Steam (and save yourself a little cash, too!).

author: {'steamid': '76561198031306027', 'num_games_owned': 739, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1458997882}
review: 这游戏并没有什么可玩性，遇敌后敌我双方都进行一回合行动，无论你是想攻击还是跑路，敌人都只会不断靠近你，所以你要么在它们接近前远程解决，要么靠近后近身肉搏，攻击不够血量不够近身基本就只是等死了，而能通过的唯一方法就是不断在前面的关卡中刷级提高血量和攻击力，这成就了这一款完全没有任何亮点的Rogue游戏

author: {'steamid': '76561198048561133', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1516563782}
review: It's a fun Roguelike, but doesn't bring anything new to the table. It's been dumbed down a bit (no diagonal movement, no hunger management, no random unidentified scrolls/potions), but it's still a good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984792918', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1459633310}

author: {'steamid': '76561198015433301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1456718206}
review:
It is cheap. It is brainless entertainment, really good if you are ill, or tired or don't want to think too much. 

It doesn't have lore, nor tactics, nor a story, nor does it look great, it is repetitive, but it is just plain simple hacking monsters and some bosses untill you reach the downmost level of the dungeon and slay the final boss. 

It took me 4 hours (with two restarts as you die permanently) to play through chapter 1 (there seems to be another chapter), which is 1,25 euro per hour, about half a cup of cappucino. The dungeons are generated randomly, so if you are looking for a lot of careless entertainment, it should suffice.

Great if you lack energy, or lack time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970602587', 'num_games_owned': 6364, 'num_reviews': 3660, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1456466022}
review:
https://youtu.be/0q6ur4WtVYo

To be clear, there is only one dungeon and multiple quests, a more accurate title would be 'Dungeon of Quests'.  That aside this little rogue style dungeon crawler gives you the option of player one of four characters to delve deep into a hostile environment filled with monsters but also loot!

The art holds the theme well but the lack of animations is a weakness for the overall product.  Monsters are varied and the simple quests drive you to explore each floor thoroughly.  Character advancement lacks depth with skills being acquired by loot drops instead of a leveling path.

It's simple, straightforward, and does exactly what it sets out to do.  There are bigger more indepth games of this genre out there but the simplicity here actually makes this game fill a niche for when just a taste of a rogue like is all that's desired.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070896943', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1452142669}
review:
What are you looking for in the next game you play?

Indie developer?
Full Controller Support?
Rougue-lite RPG?

This game has that, and more.

Pros:
+Soundtrack, though small, isn't terrible.
+4 classes available, each with an identity
+challenging, rougue-lite gameplay at every level
+Active modding community?

Cons:
-Soundrtack is small.
-The game's enemies are your standard RPG stock, without innovation. (spiders, bats skeletons, etc.)
-No progression system, meaning every death results in a complete restart, with no rewards for progressing.
-No mods as of yet for other recent pixel art games such as shovel knight and towerfall ascention.
- No multiplayer, local or online.

Final Verdict:

6.6/10 The foundation of this indie game could be built upon to be something truely exceptional, but as of right now, they ran out of money or something, and it's a good game, but not a truely great one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131417770', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1454299557}
review: I really like the concept of this game. It is very simple, yet it has some strategy aspects to it. After playing for a short time, the only thing I would suggest to add more replayability is to add some sort of purpose for doing these dungeons. Maybe a store to spend your total points gained at the end of completing a level/dying in a level. This could be for extra attack damage or something during your next run. Or make specific class 'mastery' systems or something similar. As of right now, it just seems pointless to run dungeons and get nothing from it except a 'score' which is just to compare with friends. I, however, do not have many friends that play these types of games, so it's just for a personal best (of sorts). This, I am not a fan of.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994012210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1469997020}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996090506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1453331830}
review:
Хороший рогалик на один вечер. Проходится от и до за пару часов.

В целом, вещь достаточно приятная, с толикой юмора, интуитивно понятным управлением, если ищите за чем скоротать вечер, возможно это вполне подходящий вариант.

В этой игре не стоит искать чего-то экстраординарного, этого в ней просто нет. Есть и мелкие с моей стороны недочёты, такие как отсутствие отображения статов. Вам показывают ваше  хп, ману, броню. У шмоток также есть всякие дополнительные модификаторы, например + х% к увороту от вражеских атак, или +х к ловкости. Но сколько у вас ловковсти или сколько суммарно уворота нигде не посмореть. Манчкины будут разачарованы.

Если хотите чего-то посерьёзней, то возьмите лучше Rogue Tale или ADOM. А если устали от сложности и хотите просто отдохнуть вечерок во что-то приятное, Quest of Dungeons к вашим услугам.

7 отсутствующих статов из 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198141132403', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 902, 'last_played': 1627846441}
review:
IDK who these people are who say this game isn't roguelike. It's a turn-based dungeon crawler with permadeath, random boss encounters, and resource management. It's also stupidly fun. Not too hard if you pay attention to what you're doing. I reccomend NOT using the mouse to go to spaces because it's too easy to click on the wrong space, and there's no way to stop the autowalk (which is dumb, but easily avoided).

Also? The bad guys are adorable. Less so when they're spouting off random video game references ("The cake is a lie" - gee, never heard that one before) but I love it when they say "Don't hurt me!" right before I hack and slash (or magick) them to bits. <3 <3

It's not a perfect game, but it's a perfectly fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030565079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2344, 'last_played': 1552268772}

review: 很早在java手机上玩过，那时就是消磨时间的良药。后来有了iOS版，画面和优化好了，新增了很多新意之处。玩了节奏地牢后，意外发现居然还有PC版，为了情怀入了，游戏依旧如当年，却很难找回当年的快乐了，当年的情怀，10分给8分；但就游戏本身，给6分，简单，能让你陷入其中很久，不错哦。

author: {'steamid': '76561198137605555', 'num_games_owned': 2557, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1534880433}
review: Being a randomized roguelike, yeah it's based heavily on luck. The fun from this game will get squeezed relatively fast but that's alright as it doesn't cost a fortune. This is a lot better than your average steam game, worth your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980776578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 263, 'last_played': 1451510060}
review:
To keep it short: Quest of Dungeons is not a good Roguelike and not even a good game. It has poor gameplay mechanics, a poor interface, and generally brings nothing new to the genre.
It might be acceptable if it was free since there are so many good free Roguelikes out there, like Nethack or Dungeon Crawl, and some that offer a rather different experience, like DoomRL.

author: {'steamid': '76561198187927162', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 342, 'last_played': 1698317805}
review:
Игра классная , тем более это игра моего детства . Для меня было очень настальгично вновь зайти в меню игры , и вспомнить старые времена на маге ))))) В этой игре хорошая атмосфера , куча мобов , вещей и наверное для Евреев золото  . У игры так же легко соберать значки ( от 1 - 5 лвл ) . Карточки тоже стоят не дорого . 
Но для меня в этой игре главное было почувствовать то самое наслождение детства и радости каторые я ощущял по времени прохождения игры .

author: {'steamid': '76561198007240278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1447260338}
review: I suppose if you want a simple dungeon crawler with the style of an old console game and not much semblance of depth, this would suffice. The developer seems to have hit their goal, it just turns out to be one I don't much care for. 16b aesthetic can't cover up the lack of interest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042646749', 'num_games_owned': 1460, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1448915736}
review:
This game is essentially a remake of the 1991 Sega classic "Fatal Labyrinth", which is also available on Steam. Quest of Dungeons adds a few elements to the formula, some good and some bad, but doesn't really aspire to improve it so the few flaws that Fatal Labyrinth had are still here in Quest of Dungeons. 

This game adds more loot and a store to sell and buy items. But most of the loot is just junk to sell anyway, and there is nothing worth buying except healing potions. Quest of Dungeons also tries to add personality to the player character and the monsters, but fails completely. The character says random things like "This game was made with C++" and "This game was made with OpenGL". The monsters say equally weird things, according to another reviewer they are mostly references to movies that have nothing to do with the context of this game.

Like in Fatal Labyrinth, the only way to heal between battles is to run around a bit. In this game the healing is a lot slower so the running around just to heal yourself gets even more tedious after a while.

I quit playing soon after I got to the 4th floor of the dungeon. There you encounter monsters who steal stuff from your inventory. This is another "feature" that was present in Fatal Labyrinth as well. But again, Quest of Dungeons makes an annoying feature worse. In Fatal Labyrinth the monster sometimes stole an item from you, in this game they almost always succesfully steal from you, so you see the few good items you didn't sell before going to the 4th floor disappear from your inventory at an extremely frustrating rate. And you can't get stolen items back from the monster after killing it. Within a few minutes I lost the three keys I had in my inventory (the most important items in Quest of Dungeons and not easy to find) and the better part of my gold. This is such a cheap mechanism to make a game more difficult (and Quest of Dungeons has a few of those) that it made me decide to quit playing.

Conclusion: the premise of the game is good but we saw that 25 years ago already in Fatal Labyrinth. And Fatal Labyrinth is still the better of the two games: it's longer, more balanced, less frustrating and annoying, it doesn't have the weird and even childish atmosphere and it has a "continue" system (if you play it via the emulator that comes with the Sega Megadrive Classics / Sega Genesis Classics collections, you can even save at any point). So I don't recommend this game but if you're looking to play a game just like it that doesn't have its flaws, I recommend Fatal Labyrinth instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000903121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1447203624}
review:
Short lived beautiful little game.  There's an achievement for beating the game in 30 minutes.  Well I feel a little slow because it took me 2 hours or so.  Content wise the game is good for about 6 run throughs.  First run to figure out wtf you're doing.  1 run per character (4) and then a final run to try the hardest difficulty.  That last run... may be more than 1 run...
Graphics are exactly what they seem like.  SNES style.
Controls need a little tweaking.  The default settings can get you in trouble so be sure to look over the options if you're thinking "oh why wouldn't they do it this way instead" cause you can :-P and they did! sort of...
Sound I actually really did enjoy the music.  The sound effects feel pulled right out of SNES as they intended but the music feels golden age PS1.
Story is... well it is present... technically.  They make some jokes and it's pretty good.
Overall I liked this game.  Got a few days out of it for 3$ on sale.  I'm very happy with my purchase.
Sidenote: all classes are equally inferior to the assassin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113648781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1447004801}
review: Um jogo muito simples e divertido, da para jogar apenas com o mouse se você quiser. É um RPG clássico, ou seja, possui vários tipos de itens, o game vai ficando mais dificil e envolvente a cada nivel e a medida que o seu personagem vai ficando mais forte. Os gráficos são super simples, não vemos os personagens atacando e também não vemos alterações ao mudar de armas ou armaduras, porém isso não diminui a diversão do game. Enfim, jogo muito divertido e leve, bacana para passar o tempo, nivel de dificuldade boa (não muito dificil, mas desafiador). Recomendo!!

review:
This is a weird game, but in a positive way! Simple yet amusing.
Don't expect too much of it, but it can really be addictive and fun to play.
It only has a "hardcore" mode, so dead = start over. which is the way to play a dungeon crawler imo. :-)

For this price you should give it a try and you will have a couple of hours of fun trying out the different heroes and difficulties.

enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198169092611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1670424586}
review:
Мне понравилась это игра. Да, что там понравилась, я ее полюбил! Интересное исследование подземелий, сбор лута, бои с боссами... Все было хорошо, пока я не открыл ее истинное лицо! После этого я ее удалил!

А дело вот в чем. В ТОТАЛЬНОМ дисбалансе урона. Короче, даже на самом легком уровне сложности любой квестовый или уровневый босс может убить вас С ОДНОГО УДАРА! Если у него пройдет критический урон. А в этой игре критический урон боссов где-то в 7-8 раз больше обычного, и проходит он довольно часто... Короче, тут от вас ничего не зависит - все ваши вещи и навыки - фигня. Если рандом решит, что вам пора умереть. Вы умрете. Без вариантов!

Не рекомендую.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044081373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1441217994}
review:
4/5 Worth owning.
Most of my play time with Quest Of Dungeuns has been via the Humble Store (DRM-free + Steam key + Android apk file) version. I've also played it ALOT on my Android phone. My Steam stats don't even scratch the surface of my experience with it.

PROS:
+ Fun.
+ Randomized dungeuns keep the experience fresh.
+ 4 playable character classes, with a rumored 'unlockable' fifth.
+ Very modest hardware requirements; netbook friendly.
+ Windows, Mac, and Linux versions all included.
+ Easy 'mouse click' controls, with gamepad support being added.
+ Humble Store version is DRM-free and includes a DRM-free Android 'apk' file for Android phones and tablets.
+ Android version uses a very simple touch-screen interface.
+ Steam version includes Achievements and cloud saves.

CONS:
- Graphics snobs beware.
- No multiplayer...yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004423189', 'num_games_owned': 4454, 'num_reviews': 423, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1449906964}
review:
Рогалик типовой гостовый стандартный.

Все подразумеваемые фичи (прокачка героя, лут с суффиксами-префиксами, походовые бои и так далее) присутствуют. Из уникальных есть "квесты" (которые автоматически генерируют предмет/монстра, который надо найти), скрытые сокровища на полуслучайных клетках и телепорты, которые в случайные моменты времени отправляют тебя на бой к боссу.

Поиграть, в общем, можно, но меня не зацепило совсем. Слишком много общего и мало уникального. На троечку с плюсом.

Впрочем, возможно, это только моё личное восприятие, поэтому любителям рогаликов рекомендую глянуть самим. Благо, стоит игра копейки.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141404871', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 1382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1517296665}
review:
UPDATE:  Developer has added another dungeon and a custom dungeon mode, as well as a new character - the Necrodancer.  

REVIEW:
Permadeath.  Get used it.
Premise: Return the "light" stolen by a Dark Lord.
Deceptively simple, easy, roguelike, single player, quest adventure.  Can be done in 30 minutes or less if you are good and lucky.
Did I mention Permadeath?
What makes this game a challenge beyond the randomly generated dungeons is Permadeath.  Each and every time you die the dungeon respawns and the player must begin again from the very beginning as a new character.  No in-game save points.  No tutorial.  Learn as one goes, and player arrogance and over confidence is the biggest enemy.
7 levels to traverse through with random encounters, traps, loot, side quests, and mini-bosses that will kick your butt. 
4 difficulty settings: Easy, Normal, Hard and Hell.  For Hard and Hell all those OMG 'these are stupid tricks' come in handy when the monsters are OP and there is no shop keeper to buy health or mana from.
Four character classes: warrior, wizard, shaman, and assassin each with their own unique play style and power ups (which one may or may not get during game play). 
Can you go the distance in this scoreboard game?  Simple things can be the hardest to achieve.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992511533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 182, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1438236852}
review:
TLDR: Don't buy this game, it's bad. Instead consider playing Tales of Maj'Eyal or Dungeon Crawl Stone Soup. 

Quest of Dungeons is not a roguelike, it is a roguelikelike. It is a dumb, poorly made abomination that merely contains elements that an ignorant may ask and be told, probably from a bored and indifferent source, can be found within roguelikes.

This insipid program is a mannequin of a roguelike. There is next to no variety in abilities or items. Most gear is a flat upgrade, additional stats are rare and usually as significant as +1% crit chance. It has draped itself in the trappings of a roguelike but nothing more.

It lacks many basic features such as auto-exploration, travel to landmark, or rest till fully healed. And may the Good Lord in Heaven have mercy or your wretched soul if you should even attempt to make use of the click to move feature.

Clicking on a square causes you to move to that square, even distant squares that take many turns to walk to. In those subsequent turns you get to watch your character get mobbed to death without you being able to stop it. Yes, this game lacks the basic feature of stopping auto-walk when an enemy appears or you take damage. The first time I had a character die to this I had to immediately kill off a few more just to convince myself that yes, this game is just that badly made. Had the developers placed into this game any sort of love, care, attention, or to be frank, competence, then they would have caught this.

No love was put into this game, and I presume only minimal effort. Where are the random and unindentified potions, scrolls, and wands? Where are the whacky item egos and curses? Where is the innovation? Where is the fun? Where are the things that people who love games hold so dear that they want to dedicated a significant portion of their lives just for the chance that they can share them with the world? Where is this game's voice? Oh no, not That Friend's voice. But yes, it is, and we will discuss it.

Throughout the game monsters will say famous quotes from pop culture. “Welcome to your doom.” You might open a door and see a walking tree that announces “I am your father.” No reason, no joke, no connection to anything. “The cake is a lie.” These things are just said and said and said, repeated constantly through the game. “Run you fool.” It isn't funny.

Say you find yourself, despite all good efforts, alone in a room with That Friend. You know of whom I speak, we all know That Friend.

“Do you remember Portal?” he asks, then guffaws. Using his thumb he counts down the greasy fat fingers on his other hand. Star Trek, Terminator, Lord of the Rings, Scooby-Doo. Each punctuated with a false high pitched screech that his dim mind approximates to laughter before moving down the queue to the next reference. No jokes, no punchlines, just references to the existence of pop culture icons. And then braying.

Grabbing you by the shoulders, That Friend pulls his oily face within millimeters of yours, dilated eyes blood shot and half mad, spit foaming in the corners of his filthy unwashed mouth, he screams his putrid breath into your nostrils: “Do you remember Star Wars?!” And then the noise, which you will never forget, not laughter, but a robotic repetitive pronunciation of a syllable without variation, screamed at the top of his lungs, into your face, into your rattling suicide-contemplating bones. “HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA HA!”

These syllables are devoid of humor and the halls that they echo through are indelibly darkened, even memories of mirth and joy past are erased.

This game is bad.
It was made by bad people.
But it was not made for bad people.
It was made for no one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084000741', 'num_games_owned': 606, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1437343225}
review:
If this was in early access (very early access), I'd say OK. But a full version?

The graphics are very basic. The UI is horrible. There is no tutorial nor explanation of anything (I haven't understood how to use skills at all - I played for a knight and slashing always seemed like slashing, no change). The amount of content seems quite low. The pick up button doesn't work quite often, you have to mash it repeatedly, otherwise you leave things behind. There is no story, no characters background.

Honestly, I think this game is an attempt to learn how to program. But an entertaining game requires more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027756150', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1198, 'last_played': 1523912398}
review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th]+Graphics[/th]
        [th]"16-bit retro artistic look"[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]+Gameplay[/td]
        [td]Turn based dungeon crawler - The world is randomly generated - You have to kill monsters and Bosses while progressing from chamber to chamber , leveling up , acquiring new armor+shields+weapons(No visual change, only makes you more powerful) and skills like an attack that make the monsters paralysed or an earth quake. 4 Different characters that change the gameplay. Oh and Permadeath Suckers! The bad side of the gameplay can be seen in easy and normal difficulty where you can abuse the turn based system by waiting or turning around in circles like a jackass in order to gain your health back and also the spells cooldown. You can actually still do the spells cooldown in even in hard and hell difficulties.  [/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Storyline[/td]

   [/tr]

author: {'steamid': '76561198044323597', 'num_games_owned': 11258, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 2784, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2475, 'last_played': 1436690474}
review:
- Too basic.
 - Not enough fundamental informations (for me, this is unforgivable) :
1) some skill descriptions give no in-game information (Sickness, for example)
2) can figure what the difficulty change
3) no information and tab for main stats (wisdom, resistance, agility, dexterity...)
4)  so many...
- A windows game isn't a simple smartphone game. It's need more options/improvements.

--- EDIT 08/07/2015
My opinion is fairly unchanged but I vote "Yes" now for 2 reasons :
1) [url=http://steamcommunity.com/app/270050/discussions/0/530646080842386212/#c537402115072728421]A officiel information on the "Difficulty"[/url] has been posted on the Steam forum.
2) Developers listen to players.

review: What can I say about this game? You know what standard roguelike games are like? Yes? Then you know what this game is like. It's just your typical turnbased roguelike game. It uses the 16bitSprite Pack from OryxLab so the graphics are nothing spacial either. It's just that: a Rogue-Like; nothing less, nothing more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026810941', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1644527764}
review:
Quest of Dungeons è un GDR Rougelike fantasy a turni. Si rifà ai vecchi GDR dei primi anni '90. Lo consiglio tantissimo ai nostalgici di questo genere.

PRO:
1) Rougelike 16bit. Cosa volete di più?
2) Semplice ed immediato
3) Bella l'idea di poter trovare le mosse dentro ai tomi

CONTRO:
1) Calibrazioni: può capitare che ti ritrovi il boss del livello dopo la prima porta, e tu non hai nemmeno skillato!
2) Mancanza albero delle skills: non è possibile personalizzare il proprio personaggio
3) la musica: troppo ripetitiva, ci voleva qualcosa di più.

Voto finale: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198051349695', 'num_games_owned': 274, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1433971947}
review: Quest of Dungeons is a wonderful, incredibly simplistic and enjoyable roguelike. It doesn't do anything I'd consider incredibly original, but what it has is polished (mostly) and addictive. For the price, I'd certainly recommend it to fans of the genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113095961', 'num_games_owned': 1221, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1433904224}
review: A funny, simple, extra lite rougelite that is worth a few hours of your life.  Premadeath and randomly generated dungeons make it worth a few plays. Sure it's not an epic you will get lost in, but still enjoyable and engaging. If you are looking for a quick dungeon crawl that you can knock out for a fix, then it is about the best and the humor is pretty good, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987068837', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1744, 'last_played': 1433641550}
review:
Very tedious gameplay.  Getting through the game even on easy can end up being based entirely on luck, especially with the shaman and warrior classes.  It's possible to kill every monster, complete every quest, and acquire all weapons/armor along the way and still end up getting one-hit killed by bosses.  Which suggests using skills should tip the battle in your favor so you don't get critted, but if you're unlucky your skills won't hit with their special effects, and then you're hosed.

The weapon/armor system is pretty stupid too.  You constantly receive "cracked" and "broken" items.  I don't actually recall seeing an adjective that implies the item is in good condition.  There's no correlation to how 'cool' the item looks and how much it helps you.  You might be wearing a blood sword one minute and find a wooden stick that's +25 damage the next.  It makes no sense at all.

The differences between easy and hell modes are pretty much nonexistent.  As others have said,  you  can just outrun your enemies until you heal/gain mana/ etc.  You can also lure  enemies on  to traps, so if you're out of mana and don't want to risk being attacked, you can just lure them onto traps over and over and over again until they die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033982312', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1478778757}
review:
This is probably the best graphical roguelike I have ever played. The controls are intuitive by default, and can be customized to one's liking (I recommend setting mouse clicks to "attack only" in the options menu).

While the themes and enemies on each floor are static, the layouts are randomly generated and you will never encounter the same layout twice. Most enemies rely on typical run-and-melee tactics, however they can hit pretty hard if you go to a new floor unprepared.

Gameplay is slick and seamless between floors.

Worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091297896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1448647301}

review:
Quest of Dungeons is a simple roguelike game with replayability at its core, you start with a class, one of four and progress from dungeon to dungeon leveling up until you face the final boss, the dungeons and loot are completely random and if you die, well you start over because of permadeath :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031737665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1732, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1068, 'last_played': 1465680022}
review:
Un petit dungeon crawler/rogue-like, ma foi assez simple de prise en main et agréable à jouer :)

+ Design rétro soigné
+ Gameplay simple et efficace
+ Le 100% achievements est relativement facile à réaliser

- Une classe jouable trop OP comparée aux autres - devinez laquelle

Ok ça fait plus de - que de + mais le jeu vaut quand même bel et bien le coup, en promo ou avec ticket réduc' en cas de doute sur sa valeur :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198015383860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 122112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36785, 'last_played': 1707310177}
review:
For a ROGUE style game that has been modernized I have enjoyed it quite a bit.  This is a hack and slash type adventure as opposed to a rollplaying game. I would give it 4 out of 5 stars maybe even 4.5. 

With the current BATA they have added a second dungeon and a random dungeon generator. One of the the things I think the maps could benifit from is secert doors. 

I find the ballance of the game is good for the most part the only issue I have found is that sometimes it will place a boss right at the begining of the first floor which is hard on first levelers. 

I also like the fact that you can encounter your non winning characters as ghosts. 

I hope this helps.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995982646', 'num_games_owned': 4611, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 2238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1098, 'last_played': 1611081940}
review:
[h1]Features:[/h1]

- randomly generated dungeon floors; 6 or 7 in total, depending on difficulty
- 4 playable character classes; Warrior, Assassin, Wizard & Shaman, each with their own spells
- 4 difficulty modes; Easy, Normal, Hard & Hell. 
- a brief statistics report at the end of each game
- leaderboards; for those who want to compare with other players
- all of the roguelike elements; turn-based, roleplaying, permadeath, lots of items & monsters, bosses, randomly generated floors, quests, ...


[h1]Gameplay[/h1]

QoD offers about 30-60 minutes per game. It plays fast and intuitively and has catchy tunes and sound effects.

Goal of the game is to get to the lowest floor (6 or 7), where you can defeat the end-boss and thus winning the game. 

You gain experience by killing monsters and completing quests as you progress through the floors. Mana and hitpoints (depending on difficulty level) can be regained by either "wandering around" (avoiding the word "exploring" in this context, because it's effectively possible to replenish mana and health simply by running around in already explored areas), or consuming potions or food. When having explored all of a dungeon floor, your level and equipment will be good enough to proceed to a lower floor with more difficult monsters and boss(es). 

Magic books can be found in chests and monster-drops, which you can read to learn a new spell. Each spell has a short explanation and is easy to memorize. Every spell has a cooldown period and mana cost. 

Gold is collected from monster-drops, destroying breakable objects, chests and or selling items at the shopkeeper. Equipment (weapons and armor) can be looted from monsters and bosses, found in chests or bought at the shopkeeper. 

Quests can be initiated by activating "quest poles", scattered around the floors. Basically, there are two kind of straightforward quests: "search quests"; which require you to locate and collect an object or "kill <name of boss> quests"; in which you'll have to find the boss' hideout and defeat him. While the overall approach of the game feels rather easy, the bosses can be tricky though... make sure you come well prepared. It's mostly the spell arsenal you possess at the moment that makes the difference between victory or defeat, this especially counts for the battle with the final boss.


[h1]Summary[/h1]

Fun, fast, easy to learn, easy to master; therefore making QoD an excellent beginner-roguelike, no more-no less. For experienced roguelike-players, this game is simply too basic and too easy to be taken seriously into account. Even the hardest difficulty (Hell) it is fairly easy to beat.  When having achieved a perfect game (100% achievements in 18 hours), you've about had it with the game. For me at least, i can see no further challenge and/or the need to play QoD again (soon), therefore offering little, to none, replay value.

[b]My advice:[/b] get it if you want an introduction into the roguelike genre or if you're an achievement hunter and want to quickly add 18 achievements and a perfect game to your profile. If you own other roguelikes, play them or search for other ones, but definately skip this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017088697', 'num_games_owned': 1271, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1432560974}
review:
Surprisingly fun despite it's simplicity. Combat is simple, monsters are simple, and equipment variety is meh, but the game is still pretty okay for killing some time.

Default mouse control is awful: Click once and your character will immediately try to move to that tile, not stopping even if they get smacked around by monsters on the way. You can die from a single misclick this way.
EDIT: There's a way to change the default mouse control in the options menu after starting and pausing a new game. It's not on the main page's options menu, so didn't find this option before.

Overall, decent game if you're not looking for anything deep or complicated.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034096055', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1429325093}
review:
It combines two successful genres and manages to still be a bad game. It has the monotony of bad dungeon crawlers paired with the permanent deaths of roguelikes resulting in a boring game that you will have to grind through each time you start over. It's really dull, there's no clear cut objectives or incentives to really do anything. Occasionally you'll get a quest but all the quests  I've encountered have pretty much been "Find X room in a randomly generated map." So, yeah, the quests are basically hide and seek, usually finding an item or killing a boss.

The weapon and armor system, class and combat systems are all a joke. Just the most generic randomly generated garbage being offered to you. Whether you're a knight or a mage, the combat is still the most generic and lackluster thing ever. Like, it's really hard to find a dungeon crawler that has exceptionally boring combat as that's the case with pretty much all dungeon crawlers, but this game just feels the worst out of anything I've ever played.

The end result is a game where you walk around in circles and fight random monsters. Sometimes you find stairs to go a new room to walk around in circles in. There's no incentive to do anything. You don't really change except getting slightly higher stat numbers and occasionally new abilities that don't really amount to much. The fact that this is being sold for $5 is an insult. This doesn't even feel like a game, it feels like a school project that someone didn't finish and got a D+ on. If you're a fan of dungeon crawlers don't even bother with this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091448885', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1499872962}
review:
This game is the only game i love and hate.

Basically this is a rouguelike game which you play as one of the four characters and complete a dungeon with multiple floors. Sounds easy right? No. For some reason the "easy" difficulty is harder than most games i find difficult to play. You get two-shotted by bosses on Normal mode and the only good character is the ranged one because they can't directly attack you from afar unless they are mages or archers themselves. You spend two hours on a regular run and you probably won't finish the game in this time because you die by the bosses since a crit does like 60% of your HP for some reason- and in higher difficulties a crit would end your run.

Do i reccomend this game? Yes, it's so much fun. But only if you don't mind having to start over again. Basic combat that everyone can understand sounds horrible, but it's actually not that bad as it looks on paper and fits the game very well. The graphics are very nice for a pixely game and the music really gives a nice ambience, even while it sounds so... stupid?

Trust me, you will spend an hour, die, probably not play the game again for a couple of hours or even a day and do another attempt on it the next day. You will try your *ss off so hard that you will ragequit over and over again, but you still want to see that booty when you finish the game. You will get really pissed when you open a door and a boss shoots at you or uses magic at you and crits you, making you lose the game. But you will come back. And you will pick the archer 90% of the time since you hate the other guys being f*cking more hardcore than hardcore hardcore. You will deny your gf for sex because you you are so far playing this game and you haven't died yet...

Buy it.. Buy it now.. Finish the game for us so you can save our souls..

author: {'steamid': '76561198000875712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1453061904}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008932618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1362, 'last_played': 1428739512}
review:
On the plus side, everything pretty much "just works", the basic control scheme works well with mouse or mouse+keyboard, it's well put together, there are no nasty immersion-destroying surprises anywhere. It's pretty cheap. It's a pretty small download, and launches very quickly, and uses mimimal CPU and pretty low RAM. And it works on Linux and Mac as well as Windows.

On the minus side, everything else. I can't imagine why anyone would recommend this game unless they'd never played another roguelike—and if you've never played a roguelike, there are much better ones to start with, including free ones, so don't buy this one and inflict it on other people. This is basically a roguelike, minus all the things that make roguelikes fun. I'm not expecting every game to be Nethack or Zangband, but it should at least have as much depth as the original Rogue, or why waste your time?

There are effectively two kinds of monsters: the ones you can kill without blinking, and the ones you can't possibly beat head-to-head, but can kill 100% of the time if you circle around an obstacle (or make a bigger circle with teleporters or stairs) healing after each blow. And, since there are no status effects and no actions besides attack and 9 skills/class that you will mostly not use, that's pretty much all there is to the tactics.

As for larger strategy--well, there is none. Min/maxing your character is as impossible as it is pointless—yes, there are a ton of stats, but you can't even _see_ them, much less influence them, whatever they do is opaque and largely undiscoverable, and they don't even seem to affect the game much anyway. Exploration is straightforward, because there are no real choices—there's always exactly one path between any pair of rooms, no cycles anywhere; there are no wide vs. narrow corridors, or different kinds of entrances to deal with; the only real difference between any room and any other room that matters is whether they have something to circle around or not. I suppose there are keys, and sometimes you won't have the key you need, but it's not like the key will be somewhere interesting on the level (which would at least make it as complex as Doom…); you just have to slog your way back through the previous levels hoping one of the shopkeepers will have randomly gotten the key you want, so that's just annoying, not challenging.

Beyond the basic control scheme, some things are incredibly tedious (like selling most of your inventory to a shopkeeper—mouse to the item, click, mouse to the Sell button, click, repeat 30 times). There are some keyboard shortcuts, but not for any of the parts where you'd want them.

Also, the graphics aren't really "16-bit", except for the title screen. Yes, the tiles are the same resolution as late-80s sprites. But they aren't particularly SNES-looking, or inspired in any way. And they're just static tiles; you don't get the cheesy step animation, multi-level parallax scrolling, different-sized sprites on the same screen, palette animation, or other effects that define the 16-bit look. What it _does_ look like is one of the early tilesets for the old roguelikes—and if you want that, you can play one of those games.

Also, while the game does a pretty good job keeping its resource use low, on a laptop with switchable GPUs (at least on Mac or Windows) it'll force you onto the discrete GPU and burn through battery power anyway. Not the developer's fault (I'm sure it runs just fine on a typical Intel integrated GPU, but both OS's are overzealous about switching…), but still a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118930933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1617383262}
review:
Quest of Dungeons is probably one of the best ways I have ever spent £3.99 

The game play is one of the simplest you will ever see, You can play the whole game by just using your mouse or you have you the w,a,s,d keys to move if you so chose. The game throws you into the dungeon with no tutorial so you are going to find your self dying quickly but I think it this challenge of the game that make it so enjoyable unlike most games of today if you die you have to start again. there is a "save" but this is only so you can take a break if you die the save is deleted and you have to start again, This can be annoying but it also makes you want to play it again and again. 

You start the game by choosing one of four characters warrior, wizard, assassin and shaman then you are in the game. from this point onward your goal is to kill monsters to get money to buy better stuff to kill more monsters  and repeat. you do all this so you can get further down in the dungeon in a wild hope that you might really beat the game. alone the way you find shops to spend your money, random boss's and the odd chest if you're lucky. then from you lose track of your health and die. then you press new game and give it another go  and after a few 100 goes you might really win and then you will do it all over again with the other three characters. 

over all I think this game is one of the rare case's of getting more than you are paying for because than game is simple fun and something you can sit back on a lazy Saturday and play for hours not caring about the world and for £3.99 I don't think you're going to get much better. The only thing that I would want to improve in the game in small thing like  customs characters and making it so when I equip armour it shows up on my character it seems a shame it get a cool new golden bow and it now show up in my characters hand, but apart from that I cant put the game down great fun small price the way a 16-bit game should be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115726872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1427690729}
review:

Otherwise, cute game, got it on sale, would reccomend.

review:
간단하게 할수있는 로그라이크 게임입니다. 제작사들이 꾸준히 업데이트를 하고있지만, 
컨텐츠가 부족한건 사실. 위의 소개 동영상이 모든 컨텐츠입니다. 
싸우고 물약빨고 상점가고 스킬북먹고 보스잡는게 다 입니다.
퀘스트라는게 있긴있는데, 이게 퀘스트라고 할만한 정도의 수준이 아닙니다.
겨우 어느 방향에있는 누구를 잡아라 이정도뿐.
한두판 깨보면 너무 지루해지기 때문에 좀더 지켜보시고 사시는걸 추천

author: {'steamid': '76561198109665335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1428815097}
review:
Вообще многие игры, сделанные в стиле сендбокс, выживания и инди пользуются меньшей популярностью чем экшены, шутеры, файтинг и т.п. Quest of Dungeons представляет из себя пиксельный рогалик, базирующийся на выживании в замкнутом рамдомно генерирующемся мире и сборе полезных вещей, начиная от сапог и заканчивая боевыми топорами для противостояния врагам, также отличающимся сложностью и конечно же лутом. Все это развивает интерес к игре, но стоит рассмотреть некоторые ньюансы, перед тем как покупать игру:
1)В игре происходит строгое распределение главного героя (ГГ) по боевым классам: воин, маг, шаман и стрелок. Для каждого класса присущи свое оружие и снаряжение. Стоит отметить, что предметы одного класса некогда не встретятся в игре за другой класс, ну просто б***ь перебейтесь (К примеру: Мы начинаем игру за воина, и ему никогда не выпадут предметы мага или лучника).Это немного огорчает :(
2)На каждом уровне встречаются определенные типы мобов или боссов 
3)Управление шаговое: тоесть при совершении шага ГГ с одной клетки на другую передвежение мобов осуществляется также на одну клетку. Когда же ГГ остается на клетке и не совершает движений, мобы также немогут совершать движение, что помогает воспользоваться предметами во время внутриигровой паузы :)
4) Нет мультиплеера.Тоже печально 
5)Перманентная смерть в игре!
6)После смерти ГГ доносится зловещий смех или крик нооооооууу!!! :)
Собственно это все , на чём я хотел заострить своё внимание. Такой игре я дам оценку 9,1/10, но это чисто моя оценка.
Игра очень подойдет людям,любящим инди игры в стиле пиксельного средневековья и т.д. Также очень неплохой подарок для друга!!! Нус,это все! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198066110336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1427225975}
review:
Nice light dungeon crawler with nice ambient music and neat controls. Very solid overall presentation and fun to play, despite its shallow RPG system. One major flaw indeed is the fact that just running in circles often is a desirable tactical option during a fight in order to restore your health.

Nothing too special here but very well done, easy to pick up, addicting, and fun!

EDIT: Just found out that there is no life regeneration in Hard and Hell difficulty, which makes the game much more challenging and thus yet more fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072490887', 'num_games_owned': 550, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1426585510}
review:
简单试玩了一下，暂时先通关了normal难度，问题很多。
首先是最基本的游戏性问题，这个游戏内所有角色和所有怪物移动速度完全一样，而且一切角色在出生时均没有任何控制技能，而新技能的获取也不是依靠升级，而是在游戏内随机获得在使用获得技能的魔法书，完全随机。
这使得大前期当你遇到打不过的BOSS时，你几乎没有任何办法摆脱那家伙，因为你们移动速度完全相同，你只能跟boss保持亲密的0距离一起一路狂奔，找到地图中随机生成的传送门，传送离开到同层别的位置回复，然后回来继续磨boss的血。
然而当你熟练的使用这一战术后，游戏内的所有BOSS又都变成了傻逼，因为传送门只有玩家能使用，怪是传不走的，而游戏内的生命值魔法值均可以通过回合的流逝自动回复，而boss不会，所以磨死一切boss不是梦，而这个战斗过程弱智无比又重复枯燥，你不会喜欢的。
而游戏进行了一小会之后，角色的数据会迅速膨胀，尤其是在钱的方面。游戏刚进入第三层，一瓶可以让我瞬间满血的药水只要450到900块钱，而我钱包里揣着5万块巨款，然而我惊讶的发现商店里出售的装备全都是比我身上差不少的垃圾装备，也就是说我的5W巨款除了买药水也不用干别的，而这个药水在你买干净以后还会刷新你怕不怕？喝药水没CD只消耗一回合你怕不怕？与钱包迅速爆炸相伴随的是，我的角色学会了一大堆一大堆一大堆技能，有用的没用的都不少，游戏难度随之骤降
前期过于困难，中期过后难度直线暴跌直接变割草无双的难度曲线肯定是有问题的
=========================================
总之，这款游戏作为一个传统模式的RL系统过于简单，游戏深度过浅而且数值强度和难度曲线的设计明显存在问题。但是物品、技能等游戏内容还算比较丰富，作为一个廉价的拿来休闲打发时间还是可以的。然而作为一个“RL游戏”该作品并不合格。
如果不是买慈善包的时候顺便+个1的话，不推荐购入

author: {'steamid': '76561197971948490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1426555603}
review:
Although technically not a "roguelite", as it's TECHNICALLY a "proper" turn-based roguelike, this game probably more literally conforms to the other genre title than most...

"The Orc and the Pie" is a joke about how, when you get down to it, the lazy standard of RPGs is to just say there's some monster that wants to kill you, and if you kill it, you get some random loot thing, and then get offered a chance to go kill another orc to get more pies.  Whoever made this game didn't get that it was supposed to be a joke.

Play as one of four pre-defined stereotypes with no real character customization in a series of square rooms where you can either spam the ranged attack button (if a ranged attacker) or just ram directly into enemies until they all die.  

Then, once the orcs are dead, you get to run over anything in the room while spamming the "pick up" button, and occasionally run all the way back to a shopkeeper to empty out your pockets so you can carry more random crap.  

This game's version of pies are largely uninspired.  You have potions, "food" that are potions in disguise, armor and weapons that just straight give +damage or -damage with very few exceptions, and you'll largely be fighting enemies on floor 5 the exact same way as you did on floor 1.  In fact, you'll probably be fighting the SAME ENEMIES, too, since this game palette swaps all the enemies.  

Thanks to a lack of enough mana potions, if you play the mage, you'll be treated to a basic attack spell that takes 5 MP, enemies that take several bolts to kill, and needing to waste a dozen turns to get 2 MP back.  Enjoy the tactical depth of running in circles or smashing the wait turn button for hours to get your MP back after clearing a cramped room.  Since there's no hunger mechanics, you can waste infinite time, and are directly rewarded for doing so, with only the toll upon your own patience as a disincentive.  

Bosses may be tougher than you, but thanks to the I-take-a-turn-you-take-a-turn nature of the game, you can simply walk away from bosses to prolong combat as long as necessary for your passive regen to put you back up to full health while the bosses have no regeneration.  As a bonus, "poison" type effects keep working, so getting a single lucky fireball to start tapping away 3% health per turn and then kiting the boss across the whole dungeon is easy-peasy boss cheesing. 

Beyond that, everything in this game is either scenery or a target for vandalism.  It tries to add "humor" by having random quotes put out there like Dungeons of Dredmor did, but honestly, that just reminds me of how Dungeons of Dredmor is a much, much better game than this.  The "jokes" are even mostly recycled, and I can't even be bothered to stop to read them, after a while, much like I can't be bothered to stop to pick up the bajillion coins that fall out of the hundredth palette swapped rat I just barbecued with my thousandth fireball.  

Procedural content is only as interesting as the effort put into making each area actually feel different.  This game is just the same room copy-pasted every single time.  Kick in door, kill orc, take pie.  Kick in next door, kill orc, take pie.  Rinse and repeat until your eyes bleed.  Few games manage to be as offensively boring as this...

In summary, don't play this game, it's a lazy knockoff Dungeons of Dredmor wannabe.  Play the real Dungeons of Dredmor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040649499', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1426447539}
review:
If you haven't played roguelikes before, maybe this game has something for you (albeit something that you could get in better quality somewhere else). But if you're at all familiar with roguelikes, just don't bother. 

This game lacks any real depth or strategy. Enemy behavior patterns are drop-dead simple and can be trivially abused (if even boss-monsters don't know how to chase you around a one-square obstruction without making mistakes and going the wrong way sometimes, expectations have to be set pretty low). Monsters don't have different speeds, or different pursuit-patterns, or even different immunities (even skeletons and slimes and golems and vampires and, yes, boss-monsters can be made to sleep with 100% success); they DO occasionally have different ranges and special-attacks, but that's it. It doesn't feel like an effort was made to have the treasure progression make sense; a few floors into the dungeon, you can sell inferior gear for thousands of gold, but the increasingly high-quality gemstones you find are still hovering between 10 and 20 apiece, which means the only reason you would pick them up is to make sure there's not another item hidden beneath them. Selection of gear could have been interesting, but this is another missed opportunity; few pieces of gear provide any stats other than the primary stat always provided by the gear-slot, meaning that choosing the best gear means just picking the highest number rather than making meaningful strategic tradeoffs. Any difficulty comes purely from the fact that some boss-monsters or special attacks can remove half of your health or more, but that's okay because if you know anything about tactics in roguelikes you don't have to let them attack you at all, if you play a ranged character and have patience.

Graphically, the game delivers on everything its trailers promise. There's good variety in learnable skills, incorporating status effects and areas of effect in ways that would force you to make meaningful strategic decisions, if not for the homogeneity and simplicity of the threats you face. The music is varied and enjoyable enough and fits well with the game's themes. Overall, the game's production values feel decent for its price-- except for the deep, gaping hole where game-design and strategic challenge should be. 

Long story short, if you're a halfway-experienced roguelike player, you can jump into this game on its hardest difficulty, win on your first or second run, and have no reason to go back, as was my experience. With all of the noteworthy competitors in this genre, don't waste your time.

review:
First try. choose mage like I do whenever the option presents itself, fuddle between awkward walking commands with mouse and learn to use keyboard for more precise movment. level up a few times runing around burning bats, lots and lots of bats(its ok they deserved it.) make it to a stairway and travel down, get two doors in and get murdered by a boss.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015871120', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1417972377}

author: {'steamid': '76561198043430061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1424826667}
review:
Viciante e cumpre com a promessa de um jogo estilo Roguelike, simples assim joga....morreu? Começa do zero....e tu vais querer recomeçar, não adianta! O gráfico é show nos parâmetros de 16bit parecendo o link do The Legend of Zelda, o primeiro jogo....
Cada classe possui uma forma diferente de jogar, o jogo não poupa na quantidade de skills, joguei muito com o mago, mas até hoje ainda aparece uma magia Q eu não conhecia (as skills tu aprende conforme tu pegas no loot, seja em baús e bosses).
O jogo tb apresenta um pouco de comédia em algumas partes! De resto vale a pena lembrar Q esse jogo é turn-based significa baseado em turnos, se tu gostares de jogos turn-based este é sem sombra de dúvida um jogo recomendado!

author: {'steamid': '76561198086509567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1422553429}
review:
Игра может быть описана двумя словами: Казуальный рогалик.

Для тех кто не знаком с подобным жанром, те кто не хотят заморачиваться и жать на 1 от силы две кнопки, игра безусловно подойдет, но её реиграбельность стремиться к нулю. Всё до дикости однообразно и реализовано сыро, вроде есть а, что толку? После 5-10 попытки пройти или удачного забега, вы забудете об этой игре и даже не вспомните. Большая часть тактики сводиться к открытию запертых на ключ/и и сбор крутого шмота обгоняющего по статам на этажа эдак 2-3. Дальше можно не фармить а идти дальше. Единственная проблемой могут оказаться боссы или банальная невнимательность игрока к толпе простых монстров. Дизбаланс в классах, кто-то круто выносит кто-то зависит от рандома/удачи. Вы действительно хотите в это играть?

Итог: 2 из 10. Очень недурственно для инди-разработчика с минимум ресурсов, но игра пустая и ни о чём. Может найти только самых непривередливых однокнопочных игроков с минимумом притязаний. Закос под "старину" на которых могут повестись многие олдфаги, не оправдывает себя, это просто отсутствие ресурсов для визуальной части.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041949592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 605, 'playtime_forever': 170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1479404579}
review:
Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!

This is a Roguelike  game.


[h1]Interface/Menu/Settings[/h1]

There is a music volume slidebar available.
There is a sound volume slidebar available.
There are some resolution sizes available.
You can play fullscreen or windowed mode.
There are some different languages available.

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

You are able to pick from 4 different characters.  Mage,Warrior, Archer and a Shaman. If you know the gameplay of "dungeon and dredmor", This is almost the same. They also try to be funny with some text. But failing miserably. You move from Room to room, Killing enemies, avoiding traps, doing some puzzles, picking up loot and many more. You are able to learn books, If you have found a book that you have learned already. And you are gonna use it.. The book will be removed from the inventory even if they told you "you learned this already". Every action or move that you will do, Performs and completes a turn.


Character is able to level up.
No walking character animation. It just slides over.
Okay music.
Trying to be funny with some texts like in "Dungeon of dredmor".
There is a difficulty settings.
Pretty boring.

[h1]Other things.[/h1]

Bad copy from "Dungeon of Dredmor".
I like rogue like games, But this is just waste of time.

-------------------

I Give this game a 4/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198118752633', 'num_games_owned': 2507, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 291, 'last_played': 1422854962}
review:
价格公道
难度不高，有画面的roguelike游戏。
从四个职业中选择一个，通过7层地牢，解决最终BOSS，流程上基本一层一需要三十到四十分钟。我目前已经到最后一层了，金币和道具都比较充裕，希望能够击破最终BOSS
如果是个Roguelike狂热爱好者，请从Hard难度开始

author: {'steamid': '76561198168148050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1634469109}
review:
The game is a turn-based RPG, as in you move 1 spot, so will the enemy (Comparable to Pokémon mystery dungeon but way better). You can play 1 out of 4 characters at a time, each with it's own special skillset and specialities, in difficulties ranging from easy to hell. The game itself is played in a 1 try for victory style meaning if your health gauge reaches 0, you're game over. Most of the achievements are also fun to hunt for and the game is speedrunnable for extra challenges.

Due to the retro style, difficulty and strategy needed in the later levels and boss fights, this game is very addictive and very enjoyable to play. I'd very much recommend this game to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008532830', 'num_games_owned': 1511, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1422194546}
review:
スーパーシンプルなローグライクゲー

使えるアイテムは回復アイテムとスキルブックくらいしかない。
よって殴ってライフが高くて強い方が勝つ
近づかないで殴れる遠距離攻撃が強い。逃して欲しい
ICEで凍ると死ぬ。動いてくれ頼む

ライフ回復が遅い。もっと早く回復しろ
ステがよく分からん。見せろ

総評：普通にローグライクやったほうが面白い

author: {'steamid': '76561198070893821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1422917980}
review:
Jogo muito divertido, tipico RPG por turnos, bem simples porem um prato cheio para os gamers da velha guarda.

Você vai se ver jogando durante oras, aumentando levels, derrotandos bosses e pegando itens.

Recomendo pois o jogo é bom e barato, e recomendo fortemente se ele estiver na promoção.

Se você gosta de RPGs do estilo antigo esse jogo é para você!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122475997', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1476334035}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962117428', 'num_games_owned': 258, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1643156323}
review: This game is quite difficult, where as if you die you must start from the beginning. However, it is rather fun. Play smart and remember that it is a turn based game and you will be much better off in your approach. It's cheap. The dated graphics are kind of the point of the game. It's not to be taken to seriously, but when you realize all of the subtle nuances of it, it makes it far more enjoyable. The level progression and procurring nice loot, weapons, and armor are taken into account, the game really comes alive. It's not for everyone, this game appeals mainly to the oldschool. It is surprisingly more in depth than first glance portrays. I would highly recommend this game if you have the patience and the will to play such a dungeon crawler. The soundtrack consists of very few "songs" but I find it to be done quite well.
