author: {'steamid': '76561198083954362', 'num_games_owned': 2392, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1438345132}
review:
Bardzo fajny rogalik, ale okropnie krótki, i zbyt łatwy. Od razu zacząłem na HARD, i przeszedłem za trzecim razem. Nawet nie wiem na którym poziomie się kończy (chyba piątym) bo po trzecim zacząłem lecieć przed siebie nie wymiatając całego piętra. Było tak łatwo że największym wyzwaniem był zatykający się ekwipunek. W pewnym momencie doszedłem do ostatniego bossa, załatwiłem go używając dwóch flaszek HP, otworzyłęm skrzynkę kluczem z czaszką  i nagle pojawił się ekran z gratulacjami. Gdybym wiedział że tak będzie to bym się cofnął i wyczyścił całą grę dla lepszych statystyk.
Podsumowując, to zabawa dla tych którzy lubią rywalizować wielokrotnie przechodząc grę dla podniesienia łącznych statystyk ze wszystkich rozgrywek. Mimo to polecam każdemu zjadaczowi rogali bo gra się bardzo przyjemnie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030862992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1512226884}
review:
В целом очень простая и не напряжная игра ! Если Вам надоела жесткая конкуренция в играх, [b]QoD[/b] подарит достаточно положительных эмоций. 

Тем не менее, стоит быть крайне аккуратным при встрече с боссами. Не стесняйтесь запасать бутылочки для Маны и Здоровья. Вполне неплохим маневром будет отступление, если босс зацепил критическим ударом. Смыться от преследующего босса можно через телепортер или лестницу на другой этаж. Накопите сил и вернитесь к обидчику.

Если Вы играете в первый раз, я бы [i]не рекомендовал[/i] Воина. Лучше возьмите Шамана ! Геймплей за него выглядит более разнообразно. Ну и конечно есть несколько советов для новичков, без которых не обойтись ! )

[b]1.[/b] На первых этажах, всегда покупайте у торговцев [u]ключи[/u], которых у Вас нет в коллекции ! Стоят они не много, а пригодиться могут в любой момент. Запоминайте комнаты, вход в которые возможен только с ключом. (Если у Вас нет нужного ключа) Когда нужный ключ появится, не поленитесь вернуться к такой комнате !

[b]2.[/b] Не слишком заморачивайтесь на квестах ! Иногда дают [u]квест[/u] найти "Сломанный колокольчик" или что-нибудь в этом роде ... Мы все таки играем тут как крутые "адвентюреры" а не как старьевщики ! Денег и экспы за такие квесты дают - мало. А потому обыскивать весь этаж сможет разве что - педант. Другое дело квесты на боссов. Их выполнять обязательно нужно. Ведь кроме нас никто не очистит подземелья от нечисти.

[b]3.[/b] Не экономьте [u]ману[/u] перед повышением уровня ! В верхней части экрана ползет оранжевая полоска экспириенса. Как только она доберется до края экрана, персонаж получит новый уровень. При получении уровня, - полностью восполняется здоровье и мана ! Поэтому перед повышением уровня, смело кастуйте самые дорогие заклинания.

[b]4.[/b] Аптечка* всегда должна быть под рукой ! Еще раз напоминаю что [u]бутылочки[/u] для восстановления здоровья и маны играют ключевую роль. Встреча с боссом редко проходит без использования этих чудодейственных эликсиров. Пусть Вас не смущают боссы на первых уровнях, которых легко вальнуть. 

[b]5.[/b] Игра может показаться Вам слишком жестокой ! И не удивительно, так как действует эффект "[u]пермадеат[/u]". Проще говоря, если Вас убивают, считаться Вы не сможете. Поэтому убаюкивающая простота прохождения, - самый опасный враг ! Нужно все время быть в тонусе. Все время иметь лучшее оружие из имеющегося, лучшие бутылочки из имеющихся, лучшие шмотки и набор ключей. Так например для меня, 3-ий час игры постоянно складывался сложно. Думаю именно тогда действие "убаюкивающей простоты" особенно коварно.

[b]6.[/b] [u]Денег[/u] всегда навалом ! Поэтому смело закупайтесь у торговцев самым лучшим товаром. Что Вам следует знать о деньгах, так это то, что есть ачивка "накопи миллион !"

Пожалуй это все советы для новичков, которые пришли в голову. Теперь вопросы к старичкам. То есть к тем кто в игре разобрался как следует. ) 
А. [i]Как находить скрытые сокровища ? [/i]
[spoiler]Не уловил честно говоря как их находить ?! Просто время от времени выпадают сокровища откуда не возьмись ... Может кто-нибудь прольет свет ?[/spoiler]

Б. [i]Что есть чтобы увеличить Сопротивление магии ?[/i]
[spoiler]Обратил внимание что фаерболы совсем не бьют персонажа, хотя в предыдущей партии отнимали приличное количество здоровья. Из-за чего это произошло определить не смог ) [/spoiler]

В. [i]Не все то золото что блестит ?[/i]
[spoiler]Вопрос который у меня напрашивается, а получает ли персонаж бонусы от [i]комплектов одежды[/i] ? Если я одену его полностью в красное/зеленое/черное да еще в руки дам подходящее по цвету оружие ?! Не будет ли это круче самых крутых доспехов ?[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198036592618', 'num_games_owned': 2246, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1777, 'last_played': 1433316513}
review: God I spend so much time playing this game, it's ruined my life 5 of 5 stars

author: {'steamid': '76561198152481867', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1457615648}
review:
Just bought the game, and have been playing it for about 2 hours now.  I am going to go ahead and give my review because I don't really want to spend more time on the game unless it is fixed. Maybe with the beta that is out, but I could care less.  The game looks great and it has great appeal. The classes are fun to play, and the skill books throughout  the game give the characters a good edge. The main disappointment about this game is that the bosses are extremely overpowered, and do a good double the damage that you do to them. You also have minimal health compared to them. But they are also easy to kill because all you have to do is run around the sides of the room with them following you, so that you can heal. Pointless. A good solution to this would be that the only way you can heal would be a wait button, you hold it to heal and you stand there while stuff happens around you. 
Another bad thing about this game is that NOTHING happens around you. You leave the room, everything stands there with their thumbs up their butts. Come on, make them do something. 
While playing my first character I looked at the sign with the skull on it, and it killed me instantly. Pointless?
I played a second character and walked around for a good while, beat the first floor with the boss run-away technique. Tried to go to the second floor and the game crased, erased my data. Just my cup of tea
Made a third character, a warrior. The game gets pretty simple when you get the roar attack that makes enemies scared, because you beat on them all you want. I got to floor four I think, and then stepped into the stairs on accident, game crased and erased my data. Dandy.
Edit: I have mad numerous more characters, almost all of them have died the same way, wizards freezing me continuously. This is absolutely ridiculous and there is almost no way to counter it.
Needless to say, this game requires A LOT of work.
1.) Fix the healing run, or make bosses easier.
2.) Fix the crashing.
3.) Make inventory stuff stack, it's annoying having 8 chicken legs in your inventory.
4.) Stop the intro crap. I don't want to look at that every time I start a game.
5.) Fix the spam freeze. 
6.) Make characters change with different gear. Maybe even make it more complex, instead of seeing the same art for two different swords.
7.) Some sort of auto-save, cause the crashes cause erasing of data

3/10

But as far as I see it, the game is unplayable because of its unbalanced combat, freezing, and general annoyances, and I don't see myself coming back to play it anytime soon, and would classify it as an unpolished turd.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990255494', 'num_games_owned': 2559, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 842, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 842, 'last_played': 1420877577}
review:
端的に言うならば「標準的なローグライクにスマホ的なUIをかぶせ、シンプルに見せかけているゲーム」

　操作、戦闘などすべてにおいて極めてシンプル。そこが最大の利点でもあり問題点でもあります。
　ユーザーに示される数値はHP、MP、攻撃力、魔法攻撃力、防御力程度。極めてわかりやすい物になっています。
　しかし、装備品に書かれている数字がそのままこれらの値に適用されるわけではありません。見えない各種数字と掛け合わされた上で最終的な値として出てくるようなのです。例えば、+5の装備から+10の変えたとしましょう。この場合、今までの装備より+5されるように思えますが違います。+1～+2程度の上昇しかしません。このあたりの直感的ではないものがストレスになります。

　隠されたステータスの謎
　画面上で示されないのは見える数値に直接関わる物ばかりではなく、間接的にものが多数あるようです。レジストや命中率などなど。これら存在のヒントはステータスアップが付いた装備品の表記のみ。それら数値がプラスされたとしても、元がどれだけあるのか分からないため、（数字的には）強力な装備を拾った嬉しさなどが全くありません。結局攻撃力や防御力と言った具体的に見える数字だよりの装備になってしまいます。

　ゲームとしての難易度
　ほどほどの難しさ。雑に遊ばず、それなりの慎重さで挑めば打開は目の前だと思います。
　満腹度（空腹度）が無いために、足踏み回復し放題です。手間さえ惜しまなければ雑魚戦で死ぬことはないでしょう。
　1プレイの時間はおよそ1時間～1時間半。ちょっとした時間に遊ぶにはちょうど良い長さですね。
　言語は英語のみですが、読まなくても困ることはありません。kill,sell,buyなど最低限の単語背読めれば遊べます。

　まとめ
　偶然のクエストボス戦のの理不尽死を除けばサクサク遊べて悪くありません。上に書いた隠された数字のもやもやを無視できるならばお勧め。スマホゲームと割り切って遊び捨てる分にも悪くありません。とても「おもしろい」ゲームや、やり込みを求めるならば他のゲームを選んだ方が良いでしょう。


攻略メモ
　次の階層へ行く目安は雑魚敵を一撃で倒せる強さ。
　常にライフは満タンに。
　回復ポーションは全買い。装備品は拾い物で十分。
　万全の状態では無い時にクエストボスに出会ったら扉を閉める。
　各種ボス戦は　防御（回避）アップ→足止め→スキル攻撃が楽。ポーションはケチらず消費。

分かりにくい部分
　スキルは選択後に対象を選ぶ。自分にたいして使うスキルであろうとも自分を選ぶ。グリーンの枠が出ればその対象に使える。レッドならば不可。

author: {'steamid': '76561198025000369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1421272167}
review:
Picked up this title as something that I could easily play on my laptop with the track pad, and saw it available for less than the price of a Starbuck's coffee.  Good game, not great.  A few questionable design choices but I've had fun bashing a few dungeons now and will be heading back for more.

Pretty and readable pixel graphics, charming if somewhat out of theme music.   

Difficult with the normal setting, I might try the easy setting and see if I get more out of the game.  

Lots of monsters to slay, love being taunted by rats and bats!   Even more objects in the world to smash, and almost everything will provide some kind of loot.  I am curious how the loot scales up as I go deeper in the dungeon, but during the first two levels it seems very random.. maybe a little too random.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169103954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1420342189}
review:
シンプルなローグライクゲーム。ランダムマップ制で１歩１ターンってやつですね。鉄則「死んだら終わり」も当然のこと（中断セーブはあります）。

これくらいのインターフェースなら、英語が分からない人でも遊べるかなと。戦士(剣)や盗賊(弓)なら選択肢も少なくておすすめですかね。
マップ内でクエストを拾うことがあり、「１Ｆの北東の○○を見つける」等の指令をクリアすればボーナスEXPがもらえます。(逆に言うとEXPだけなので無視しても良さそう？)

特に複雑な要素も無く、初見で何をやるべきかわかる感じのとっつき易さがあります。
ちょっとした空き時間で遊べる手軽なゲームとしておすすめです。
――――
「ここからは君一人で行くべきだ」「へ？」
「だって君は剣を持っているだろう？」「ちょっと待って意味が分からない」
「俺たちはここで待ってる」「‥‥わかったよ」

「奴は死んだな」
「ああ」

author: {'steamid': '76561198004277645', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1420264884}
review:
4つの各ジョブが獲得するスキルもそれぞれせいぜい10も行かない。その中でも有用なものは更に少なく半分くらいはほとんど使わずに終わる。
武器や装備も威力の設定だけで、特殊な付加効果も無く、ステータスアップくらいのもので個性も無い。
敵にしても個性も特殊能力も幾つか設定されているものはあるにしても大して効果的で面白い感じも無い。

シレンとかトルネコとかに比べると超シンプルで深みも無く、あちらの方が面白いのは確実なんだけど、なんだか結構何度も死んで最初から繰り返してやって何時の間にか気が付くとえらい時間が経過している。

なんだろう、この感じ。そんなに面白い訳じゃないのに妙に中毒性がある。

ただいただけないのは、自分の防御力に比べて一部のボス敵の攻撃力がアホみたいに高い。
遠距離攻撃一撃で即死とか、こういう「死んだら最初からやり直し」のゲームで、それはどうなの？というところがある。

author: {'steamid': '76561197984226661', 'num_games_owned': 735, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1420136534}
review:
Un excellent rogue-like hardcore, très addictif !

Un concept simple, un gameplay efficace, 4 classes, des niveaux générés aléatoirement, du loot, des marchands, des sorts, que du bon.
Une rejouabilité au rendez-vous, une musique sympa et après une quinzaine d'heures passées sur le titre (version non steam pc et tablette) on  ne demande qu'à relancer le jeu ;)

A acheter en dessous de 5€ sans hésiter ;)

review: It can start off hard, but if you use strategy and doorways to your advantage you can get the needed items to survive. I love the game and find a great homage to Guantlet. Get it, if you love dungeon crawlers or roguelikes, you will be extremely satisfied.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040910753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1480623383}
review:
Ennuyeux au point de ne pas finir une partie qui se passait très bien.
Pour cause, un manque d'intérêt général aussi bien au niveau du level design, du gameplay au ras des pâquerettes, qu'au niveau de l'interface super giga relou.. pas d'assignation de touche aux sorts, et du looting au CLICK ! oui, au click. Pas moyen de marcher sur une pièce d'or pour la récupérer non non non; faut cliquer. 

Au début pas de problème, on découvre, on est heureux de commencer une "run" (pas tellement rogue-likesque ici), mais très vite on en a marre de cliquer 20 fois par salles.

J'y remettrai pas les pieds de sitôt..

ps: la blague de l'intro est rigolote. Voilà, .. super...

author: {'steamid': '76561198090593224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1430325290}
review:
Linux users: on my setup (fedora with gnome 3.x, noveau and bumblebee) game crashed few times, mostly during minimizing and switching between apps, but not limited to those cases.

As this game tries to appear oldschool, I will review it as oldschool one. First of all, gameplay sucks. I played a lot of dungeon crawlers, and simply this one has nothing good in it. There is no character development - you will gain experience that will level you up, but you have no infuence on how it affect your hero. There are spells - a few for each character class - and some of them are overpowered, others aren't usable at all. The gameplay is too simple; what is fun in such games is finding best strategies, finding weakness in different enemies, and constant threat, but there aren't any of them. All this makes this game too easy. What is more - design should be kept fully oldschool. Although i like style everything is made, the animation of dying monsters is terrible. Imagine this: everything is made of really, really BIG pixels, yet, when monster dies, there is animation of rotating and rescaling it, showing full potential and resolution of your display. It just doesn't suit there. 

To sum up, if you want to play good dungeon-crawler, choose something else - good alternatives are for example Desktop Dungeons, or Dungeons of Dredmor. They will give you much more fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974984968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1419834594}
review:
기본적인 요소만 들어있는 심플한 로그라이크. 

던전을 돌아다니며 몬스터를 죽여서 레벨을 올리고, 보물상자를 털고 돈을 모아 장비와 아이템을 사고  정말 그것뿐인 게임. 죽고난 뒤에 능력치나 장비를 다음 플레이에 일부 계승시키는 시스템 같은건 없어서 죽으면 진짜 그냥 끝이고, 배부름 시스템도 없어서 던전에서 굶어죽을일 없지만 특별한 회복 수단도 없어서 최대한 빨리 상점을 찾아 포션을 사거나, 운에 모든걸 맡기고 회복 관련 스킬북이 나오길 빌어야 한다. 또한 적아군 전부 대각선을 향한 근접공격은 불가능하기 때문에 입구에 자리 잡으면 바로 코앞에 적이 3마리 늘어서 있어도 자동으로 일대일 대치 상황이 된다. 반면 원거리 공격은 사방팔방으로 가능하기 때문에 적 궁수나 마법사의 공격을 전략적으로 회피하는건 사실상 불가능하고 약빨고 닥돌하는거 밖에 대책이 없다. 포션 종류는 마셔보지 않아도 미리 정해진대로 작동해서 굳이 이거저거 시도해보는 위험을 감수하지 않아도 되지만, 종류가 HP와 마나 회복과 피통과 방어력을 올리는등의 몇종류 안된다. 한마디로 위기 상황에서 기발하게 탈출 가능한 포션이나 스크롤 같은건 없다. 랜덤성은 시작지점 바로 옆에 강력한 보스가 대기하고 있는 경우도 종종 있을 정도. 죽어라 쫓아오지는 않고, 그냥 고대로 투닥거리다 죽고 새로 시작하면 되니까 별문제는 아니겠지만 랜덤성이 너무 강하면 때로는 좀 황당스러운 느낌이 드는걸 부정할 수 없다.  스토리는 뭐... 없는거나 마찬가지고. 이렇듯 보는 관점에 따라 장점, 단점이 엇갈리는 요소들이 많다. 

결론적으로 현대 로그라이크 게임들에 도입되어 있는것들을  이거도 쳐내고, 저거도 쳐내서 거의 원형만 남겨놓는 식으로 너무 쉽지도, 너무 어렵지도 않도록 밸런스가 잡혀있는데 그 심플함 덕분에 로그라이크 특유의 생사와 결과에 연연하지 않는 느낌은 살아있지만 그만큼 맛이 심심하다. 하지만 사람이 맨날 기름지고, 자극적인거만 먹고 사는거도 아니지 않는가? 솔직히 던전이 너무 짧아서 추천할까 말까 망설여지기도 했다. 던전 탐색형 로그라이크임에도 던전 마지막층까지 가서 보스 잡고 마지막 보물 상자 열고 끝이라니!? 모름지기 던전 탐색형 로그라이크라면 던전 마지막층에서 찾은 보물을 가지고 다시 지상으로 되돌아오는 과정까지 플레이해야 하는법! 뭐?... 그런법은 없다고? 없으면 말고...

author: {'steamid': '76561197983485859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1419798021}
review:
This is a very casual roguelike: dungeon crawling, turn based combat, random maps and items, etc. However there are few tactical actions and inventory elements. In other roguelikes, most items are unidentified at first, and blindly trying every potion, scroll, armor, etc., where may be dozens of different kinds, becomes a part of the game as well. But in QoD there are no such elements and thus there is little replayability. The skill tree for a character can be available half game. You keep leveling up but don't get new skills.
So, this is a roguelike you can finish. It is enjoyable for a while, but once you have finished the game with one character there is little incentive to keep playing other than to see the skills of the other ones (which, as said, can be done quickly).
I guess I'll "recommend" the game, but don't expect much if you are familiar with other roguelikes. Word of advice: play in "hell" difficulty or you may find it way too easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025285500', 'num_games_owned': 958, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1419922856}
review:
For it's low price it's a pretty decent game, but each play through is hit or miss. I played a few rounds with different classes and my success with a character was entirely dependent on if I got a good spell or weapon within the first floor. Otherwise I found that as soon as I encountered a boss my options were reduced to dying. What really upset me was a play through as the archer. I got to floor 8 and I was essentially a god. I was mashing former bosses into pieces, and I one or two shot everything, and I was generally untouchable. Then I run into some weird mage, and it fucking one shots me! I'm fine with a bit of diffaculty, but that was bullshit. A one shot should never happen in a game like this where your ability to react to such things is minimal at best. 

I guess to sum up if you've got a couple bucks, and a couple hours to kill go for it. It's not bad, but the game doesn't seem to have a consistent diffaculty curve, and you can easily find an entire hour wasted because of some random one shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089751676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1514516003}
review:
What is Quest of Dungeons

Quest of Dungeons is a 16 bit 2D rouge like adventure game. Where you are sent by your party to adventure randomly generated dungeons and defeat the bosses that lye ahead. The game was designed by David Amador and released back in March, 2014.

Review

Quest of Dungeons is not for the hardcore rouge like player but, the simplistic and average player that wants something to do for a couple mins because you have time to spare. The game has many features such as:

Randomly Generated Dungeons
Four playable classes
Comical humor
Many different items
Chance to fight your own ghost
Achievement system (Beta)
Unlock-able content
Large inventory system
Replay Value
The game lacks from a "real" rouge like dungeon crawler when it comes to survival. In Quest of Dungeons David got rid of the food system so you no longer need to eat to survive, larger inventory so you do not have to make those drastic choices of keeping an item or not.

Although, Quest of Dungeons may not have everything a rouge like game would. It is fun none the less and would recommend this game to anybody looking for a fun dungeon crawler with much replay value. For $4.99 the game is worth the time and enjoyment you will get out of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056306693', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1419278566}
review: Arbitrary, lacklustre, and boring. Every floor, the mechanics are the exact same - same keys, door, quest, loot, destructible types. Every monster acts the same, can move only one tile (which makes any strategy void, as you can kite anything till your health, cooldown, mana, et cetera recharges) and uses no strategy, not even using range advantage well. There are only regular monsters which are downright boring and uninspired, and never pose a challenge (and only about 2 or 3 types per floor) and boss monsters, which are variations of the same monsters. Either you take them on and hope you have high enough equipment/stats to beat them (using a few spells when available) or you just kite them and use the health regen/cooldown system ad nauseam. That's it. That is the entire game. Nothing more. Despite the low price, I actually feel cheated out of my 2 euro's. Would definitely not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022921429', 'num_games_owned': 861, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1419172975}

author: {'steamid': '76561198075405283', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1143, 'last_played': 1446335678}
review: Quest of Dungeons, um ótimo jogo BR na steam. Depois de meses sem jogar testei o beta da nova versão que vem em breve, e percebi uma grande melhoria que me fez retomar a jogatina e aguardar o lançamento desta versão. Um roguelike bem singular por essas terras, nostalgico e a trilha sonora é bem imersiva. Tem uma dificuldade muito boa, tem que administrar bem o loot, vender, comprar keys e potions. Tentando aproveitar cada oportunidade que tiver para fazer upgrade nos equipamentos. Algo que pontua muito bem a dificuldade deste game é que não apenas você faz uso de skills, as criaturas usam de uma forma muito inteligente também, causando sangramento, congelamento e etc em momentos cruciais. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198045358495', 'num_games_owned': 1016, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1627935433}
review: Quest of Dungeons is a fun and retro game. I love its classic style of being a dungeon type of game, but it keeps a simple and easy game. The learning curb is super easy and I only criticize that it becomes slightly repetitive. The music sounds like a classic arcade game which goes sweet with the game. The graphics and their old appearance add to that great atmosphere. But as far as replaying it goes, it does kind of get repetitive. The 4 classes do allow for some extensive replaying of the game but to only an extent. Apart from that, the game is great to have for a short burst.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084017246', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1446586023}
review:
Tja, was soll man sagen: Es ist halt ein Rogue-like und kein Rogue-lite! Mit anderen Worten: Rundenbasiert, RPG, Dungeoncrawler, Looten und Leveln und BOCKSCHWER. So gehört sich das für einen Vertreter der Zunft. Beim achten oder neunten Run auf easy habe ich das erste Mal das Spiel geschafft, und das auch nur mit dem Assasinen (Bogenschütze).
Insgesamt stehen im Spiel 4 Klassen zur Auswahl. Ein Krieger, ein Assasine, ein Magier und ein Schamane, wobei die beiden Magieklassen wirklich Bockschwer und sehr von ihren Skills abhängig sind. Übrigens beide Nahkämpfer und sehr, SEHR schnell tot. Der Krieger als klassischer Nahkämpfer ist nicht gar so schwer, der angenehmste Charakter ist der Assasine, der allein schon deswegen einen riesigen Vorteil hat, weil er auch ohne Skills auf Distanz angreifen kann. Damit ist er von allen Klassen die, die am einfachsten zu spielen ist.
Das Gameplay geht sehr flüssig von der Hand, mit der Maus steuert man den Charakter (geht alternativ auch mit den Pfeiltasten oder WSAD), öffnet die Menüs (geht auch mit Shortcuts), visiert Ziele an, also Gegner und Gegenstände, und wählt die Skills aus. Diese müssen im Übrigen jeden Run neu erlernt werden, das passiert in dem man sie aus Büchern lernt, die von Gegnern oder Kisten gedroppt werden.
Kein Oberhammer, aber durchaus erwähnenswert ist der Soundtrack, welcher atmospärisch durch die Ebenen loopt und einem die richtige Stimmung vermittelt (Highlight: Die Shopmusik!).
Kurzum ist "Quest of Dungeons" ein wirklich guter Rogue-Like, für den fünf Euro alles andere als zuviel verlangt sind; klare Kaufempfehlung!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994480308', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 296, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1418242172}
review:
Mind-numbingly simple combat, completely forgettable character classes and art, possibly the most boring loot / player progression I've ever seen, and mechanics that were proven as broken in 1995. For example:

You recover HP by moving around. Okay, that's pretty standard. But every monster moves exactly as fast as you, and they do not recover HP. So you can beat every single monster in the game by running in circles while they fruitlessly chase after you, chipping away at their HP when it's safe. This is unbearably tedious, but it's the "correct" way to play, especially since the game has no qualms with guaranteed boss monsters that two-shot you on the first floor. 

Better games solve this problem (that, again, was established twenty years ago) through a variety of methods. Monsters that are faster than you, monsters that heal when you walk as well, wandering monsters that can show up and block your path, etc. Quest of Dungeons' developer has made a technically competent game, but he is a very poor designer.

Pro Tips for aspiring roguelike developers: read this, the design philosophy of the best roguelike out there. http://crawl.develz.org/other/manual.html#n-philosophy-pas-de-faq . I'm not saying every game has to be exactly like Crawl, but for the parts of yours that are different, you should be able to explain why you chose to make them that way. 

Anyway, that was a huge tangent for a very mediocre game. To sum it up: don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140701429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1476537849}
review:
Que dire sur Quest of Dungeons ? Jeu indépendant, la première fois que j'y ai joué, c'était sur mobile et j'avais déjà apprécié cet univers pixelisé plutôt old-school, après avoir fini plusieurs fois le jeu avec le taux de personnages qui n'est pas colossal mais qui est tout de même satisfaisant, j'ai aperçu alors le jeu sur Steam à 5€, j'ai tout d'abord réfléchi s'il valait le coup mais je me suis quand même décidé à le prendre, et j'ai bien fait ! Les nouveautés sont rares, les succès apportent un petit plus au jeu même si je trouve parfois les commandes plus complexes que un appareil tactile, on s'y habitue rudement vite.

Ainsi, c'est un jeu fort appréciable, plaisant à jouer et surtout à explorer, un Rogue-Like splendide créé par David Amador qui est une personne très sympathique et qui ne cesse d'améliorer son jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061299129', 'num_games_owned': 1109, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1610665728}
review:
昔ながらのターン制のRPGらしい中世ファンタジーな雰囲気のローグライクゲームをずっと探していました。
某社のゲームセンターにあったローグライクRPGのメダルゲームでローグライクと言うジャンルにハマってから、このようなゲームがないかどうかずっと探していましたので、同じような方は絶対に楽しめることと思います。

シンプルながらも、武器や防具などのアイテムの種類もなかなか豊富で収集も楽しめます。
また、昔ながらのローグゲームらしく、死んでしまったらゲームオーバーで最初からと言うところも、今の時代のゲームに慣れた人には新鮮で味があります。
最初からと言っても、もちろん死ななければセーブしておくことも可能なので、ずっと維持するプレイスタイルも叶います。

簡単なレビューになりますが、私にとってはこれ以上ない作品と言えます。

author: {'steamid': '76561198083317946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1416382628}
review:
I knew I was going to like this game the second I bought it. The only problem is, I could not get the game to start to save my life. Finally, my friend figured it out. 

If you are having issues with the game not starting: 
Go to your library
Right click this game
Go into properties
Click the Local Files tab
Click Browse Local Files
When you get into the folder, click the GameDependencies folder and accept those programs.

 The game is supposed to do this automatically, but it's no big deal. It has very addicting gameplay, a lot like a game called Pixel Dungeon that I play on my phone, and the sense of humor in this game is amusing. I walked into a room, a mimic chest popped up, screamed "YOLO" and then chased me out of the room. If you're looking for a rouge-like game, and you have 5$ to spare (or less if it's on sale), then I definitely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053191880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1461131694}
review:
It's crazy how easy you can say "I'll add this one to my Favourites". I tried lots of this kind of games but this one is special.
I can invest a lot of hours playing it.
It's an RPG, what means a lot for me. With progressive leveling and all kind of regular and/or special items.
I totally recommend it. It's not easy (I don't like the easy ones), just expect a lot of fun and prepare to DIE.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967653729', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1428351258}
review:
Immediate problems with controls. Clicking anywhere means you run to that location, with no way of stopping it if you misclicked and a boss is coming after your booty.

Keyboard controls aren't very viable for ranged characters, and it's much easier to use the mouse in this case, but you again run into the aforementioned misclicking problem.

Objects like traps can't be clicked on for context menus. Though you can disarm a trap by running over it, it's more of a save roll than an actual attempt to disarm.

Item drops and money are very sketchy. Most of the drops are crap, as is somewhat expected, but then at the same time, you'll get stupid overpowered items more than seems likely. Money drops in 10-40, while items start off in the 2000s range.

All in all, this is the worst roguelike I've ever played. Don't waste your money. There are a handful of better ones on the steam store, most of them for the same price these days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147869140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1416234836}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198053131378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1446522852}
review:
As much as I would love to give a positive review, because it is a fantastic game. Even just the beginning is funny. But the whole game is always about: find one thing or kill that boss.

Speaking of boss... Why so hard? You need to go farm the floor after just to get a few more levels before facing the boss of the prievious floor. Why?

Melee characters are weak as fuuu compared to mage and rogue. Even rogue gets super weak very fast. I managed to get floor 8 with the wizard and died of a boss which was right at the door and managed a single lucky crit. Also, I don't know for the others, I had nearly one million gold before I died, and I never had anythingt good in shop beside once or twice I got a doom key (which are kinda rare) Otherwise, I always got mana potions because the mana regen ridiculously slow.

Monsters in general are relatively easy to beat other than some floors where the difficulty increase very quickly (I think of floor 5 I think with the vampires)


There is too many little things that irks me. It could definenately be better. Like some others said, there are better roguelike games out there. This one is decent but do not expect too much. 

It is only fun once you get the twist and to waste time. Nothing else (could be a mobile game, that would be a lot better.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198095568616', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1410289390}
review: This game honestly took me about 3-4 deaths to figure out that it was turn-based.  Most of the enemies aren't too bad, but bosses are much more difficult.  Spamming arrows as an archer only works for a few turns before a boss is already on you, and then you're dead in about 5-6 turns, depending on how many potions you have at your disposal.  The pixel graphics are okay, but they could be better.  Enemies are pretty standard, including bats, skeletons, and vampires.  Nothing special and there are better rogue-likes out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987531985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1707184832}
review: This game is tons of fun with a nice soundtrack. I can definitely recommend this to be picked up whenever it goes on sale. Melee has a bit of a rough learning curve and ranged is leagues easier to play as for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077624633', 'num_games_owned': 7620, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 1405, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 828, 'last_played': 1546462045}
review:
By playing as either a Warrior, a Wizard, a Assassin or a Shaman you have to traverse dungeons, defeat enemies and loot everything you can in order to survive. You can learn new skills in Tomes you find along the way and buy/sell items at shops. 
The entire game is procedural so you won't find items/enemies in the same place each time you play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017436910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1653012659}
review: I really want to like this game, but I simply can not adjust to the control scheme.  It is awkward and uncomfortable, as it forces you to use both the mouse and keyboard although it feels like you shouldn't as their functions overlap.  Good graphics, fun character choices, decent game really but I cannot get past the controls for some reason, it just never "clicks" and feels unnatural to me.  It all boils down to gameplay in the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024932299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 787, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 727, 'last_played': 1437173016}
review:
This is a simple old school (style) dungeon crawler. You have one life to beat through 7 levels. Each level is randomly generated and has randomly generated instances. For example: Locked rooms full of chests, boss monsters, and the possibility of quests. There are 4 difficulty levels; Easy, Normal, Hard, and Hell. You play as one of four classes; Warrior, Wizard, Hunter, and Shaman. The bosses are quite challenging, especially at early levels. 

Now, while I recommend this game, I would have paid a lot more for a game with more features. I think for the $5, you get a great and fun time killer. It's interesting and intertaining. I think even with multi player, it would have added a lot more to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098819079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1488294336}

author: {'steamid': '76561198076375115', 'num_games_owned': 971, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1555192761}
review:
1: I would recommend this to people who would like to play roguelikes but think that games like rogue are too difficult.

2: Or people who would like to play roguelikes but think that most roguelikes lack graphics.

3: But especially to people who play a lot of roguelikes, and would like a more casual alternative as a filler.

4: It runs very well on Linux.

5: It is cheap.

6: The soundtrack is lovely.

7: Shaman and Warlock are interesting classes that you don't see often.

8: The creator seems to be a pleasant guy who keeps in touch with the fanbase.


8/8 m8. Would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032447372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1413086522}
review:
"Quest of Dungeons" is a decent rogue-like RPG dungeon-crawler.

Unfortunately, while all usual/required elements are there, they fail to capture your interest for long enough. Monsters are same (and can't really harm you, only bosses can), only two types of quests are available, no special gear to speak of, levels are repetitive and larger than they should be.

Your character gets fully developed within first two levels, but there's at least seven levels in the game. So, I got bored pretty quickly ...

Again, this is an OK game, but by far not the best representative of the genre available on Steam ...

author: {'steamid': '76561197985064116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 146, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1428175889}
review: Un bon petit rpg. A prendre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093170070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1413009857}
review: This game is great i'm recomending it to all of my friends. the atmosphere has a dirty feel to it, the music is great, everything about quest of dungeons is perfect. I love the witty death phrases, and the shopkeeper has the best comments. you can't get mad at the game when you die, because you are so proud of the fact that you took time to play it. the only thing that is keeping it from a 10/10 is nothing. 10/10. great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047158566', 'num_games_owned': 1113, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1412290732}
review:
If you're looking for a great pick up and play RPG, this is it. Quick to the point, simplistic, intuitive controls (eventually found myself playing with a single hand: movement+attack).

Don't let the comedic relief fool you, this game is unforgivingly hard. If you're a casual gamer like me who's never played a perma-death game before, be prepared to watch yourself die and try, try again! BUT THAT'S THE BEAUTY. This game is simplisticly addictive you'll find yourself playing multiple playthroughs of just one character for hours. Replayability stacks even more between the 4 classes and 4 difficulties.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138012116', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1415060202}
review:
I recently got a 66% off coupon for this game and thought "what the heck, I have nothing better to do with my life", so i bought it for a little over a dollar.

After playing the Binding Of Isaac i thought already knew what tricks games like this had to offer. My first time playing i chose the warrior class and spawned in a room with a vase and a sign with a skull on it, me being my curious self, decided to click the sign, it killed me instantly. I started another playthough extremely confused and i clicked the sign again, died instantly.

10/10 Insta-kill death sign.

Actual Review

Quest of Dungeons is a game that doesn't require much skill to play as it is a point-and-click dungeon explorer, however, that does not mean it is an easy game nor is it a short game, the goal is to make it to the end of a certain amount of floors (seven I think?) and beat the final boss. You play the game in turns so everytime you move one square, attack or use a consumable that counts as a turn and your enemies can move or attack you in that time.

 On my first actual playthrough on the easy difficulty it took me about an hour and a half to get to floor 5 after exploring every single room and doing all of the quests, i had some of the best gear i could find when i went up against the boss of the floor, got cocky and didn't drink a potion, he killed me, again that was on easy the difficulty goes up to hell.

I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys a good roguelike game that allows them to just sit down, relax and click the left mouse button.

TL:DR 

Simple concept, fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975900611', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1453550260}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020458128', 'num_games_owned': 1300, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1412744441}
review: This game is a bit of an unnecessary time sync with no real reward. It's fun going through it the first time... until you hit the last level and a normal-monster wizard kills you in one shot, thereby ruining hours and hours of work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066690807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1464805917}
review: This game and I have a love hate relationship. I love it because its just like those good old games, but then you realize you only have one life and you get so far and die and then you just hate the game. Only to come back to it half an hour later. It is almost addicting that you just HAVE to beat it no matter how many times you need to restart. This game is amazing in such a simple way!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061799256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2262, 'last_played': 1542900330}
review:
Oh man, where to begin.

A very decent game I'd like to think. I started to play it a while ago and once I got another game I didn't play it for a while.

I came back to it thinking I hadn't played in a while and I've now sank hours and hours into this game trying to get further and further with it, failing with the paladin, haha. 

I decided to try for the archer and I'm not winning there either so this game is certainly challenging regardless of which difficulty is chosen.

The loot is definately varient too, sometimes you get poor loot and sometimes you get fantastic loot while the dungeons themselves are always different which is fantastic, you never get the same map no matter how much you play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045940674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1446237229}

author: {'steamid': '76561198031613899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1414533862}
review: I bought this game for something to play while watching tv, something that didn't require alot of attention or focus....it's 2:30 in the morning! Wtf happened to the last 3 hours?! It's so basic yet addictive that it's very easy to get hooked in and lose track of time. Totally worth the 4 bucks I paid for it. Definitely recommend to anyone who has some time to kill and loves their retro dungeon crawlers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032588515', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 138, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1427627980}
review:
its like SOTS: The Pit, or Clasturphobia... except this game is the bare minimum without the little extras that makes those games unique and intresting. compared to simular games like this.. This game is a waste of money and time.

its just meh, items, enemies, animation, music, gameplay.. its just outdone by other games, keep looking you will find something better.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970126730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1539535110}
review:
I recently received this game as part of a humble bundle, and I'm wishing I had it long ago! I wasn't sure what to expect, but it's a very fun twist on a rogue-like dungeon crawler. Time only progresses when you perform an action or move, so it can be played as quickly or as slowly as need be, plenty of loot and some interesting enemies to keep you on your toes.

I love how it not only stays true to the nostalgia of the graphics, but to the difficulty as well. You may cruise through 4 floors and then start to get careless and get 1 shot by running headlong into a boss. 

10/10 Highly recommended for anyone who would enjoy a difficult but fun dungeon crawler. (There are lower difficulties, so I imagine it doesn't have to be this difficult, but I'm enjoying it too much to tone it down).

May update the review as I log a few more hours

author: {'steamid': '76561198010961336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1412212959}
review:
Quest of Dungeons lacks basic functionality that should be included in every modern roguelike.

[b]1. Wait until healed[/b]
Optimal (non-speedrun) play requires you to wait until health, mana and cooldowns are restored. But since there is only a command for waiting a single turn, you have to press the Enter-key a hundred times after each battle for optimal play.

[b]2. Stop moving when encountering an enemy[/b]
When using the mouse the character keeps moving no matter what happens. It will even try to pathfind-dance around enemies for several turns, instead of stopping.

[b]3. Auto-explore[/b] (optional)
Auto-explore is a nice feature found in many modern roguelikes. It speeds up the process of searching through the last corners of every level, putting more focus on more interesting stuff (loot and tactical battles).

author: {'steamid': '76561197975506157', 'num_games_owned': 1597, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 170, 'last_played': 1423588023}
review: This is a cute rogue 16-bit looking dungeon crawler that's fun to play at places such as being at work! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197988885194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1412149749}
review:
The best way to describe this game is "Phoned in". This has  been one of the most cookie cutter, lazy, bland roguelikes I have ever played. I feel like there was barely any effort put into it at all and there are SO many better options for this kind of game out there.

For one it has the problem of being at the whim of the RNG. "You looked through the whole floor and found one piece of gear? Tough luck.". Also the game punishes you for looking in objects for stuff. Every object you search has a chance to spawn in a ton of enemies. All the games mechanics work against you and want you to die so it can laugh at you when you fail.

A roguelike needs more the a RNG and a bunch of enemies to be interesting. This game does nothing that other games havent done before. Take the 5 bucks you would have dropped on this and get Dungeons of Dredmor, a GOOD roguelike with some actual effort put into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197962402602', 'num_games_owned': 2596, 'num_reviews': 361, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1412137914}
review: The most unique "feature" of this generic rogue-like is that your character always starts off standing beside a sign. In normal, sane games like this, you can read the sign for basic controls and such. But in this game, clicking on the sign instantly kills you. The sign doesn't actually say anything. The game doesn't explain what happened. It isn't a brutal early lesson about examining things carefully before risking your character - there's no trap or curse on the sign, it just kills you for NO REASON. Other rogue-likes are prettier, have better interfaces and while they may be random and unforgiving, aren't STUPID like this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095528613', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1670583529}
review: I think it would be a very fun game if you didn't have to start over every single time you die. I love everything else about it but that lack of saving and check points really made what would have been an amazing game into a somewhat mediocre game. But, I will give a recommendation in hopes that the developer will add this to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028736783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1434003257}
review:
Great game and full of potential, although that being said I do feel the difficulty curve is way out of wack. I haven't made it further than level 3 yet but bosses so strong, I haven't been able to kill one on anything other than rogue simply because they 2 hit any other class, I don't have any suggestions but just putting it out there. Also rogue seems like easy street haha. Like I said though I do like it, moving diagonaly would be a nice touch. The experience bar being prettied up would also be nice but obviously not important. Is the intention for us to be allowed multiple spells on our spell bar? Or to have to choose only one which we can use?

Apart from that the only thing I see as being super duper important is multiplayer, if you add multiplayer I would recommend without hesitation. Right now it is fun but a little hard due to getting one hit from bosses even on floor 1 in easiest difficulty as warrior, lol.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044315801', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1518083265}
review:
Классический "рогалик", очень привлекательный, стильный, отдающий олдскулом, не дающий ни на секунду расслабиться, про графику говорить даже не смысла "16-бит наше все". Все уровни, вещи, мобы генирируються каждый раз рандомно, так что какое никакое, а разнообразие приствует. Геймплей не надоедливый, очень динамичный, на выбор дают несколько боевых классов, на каждом из которых придеться осваивать новую тактику борь бы с мобами, даже где то стороит стратегии и прорабатывать пути отхода)
Рекомендую к покупке людям не равнодушным к "рогаликам" и просто любителям олдскульного графона, для тех кто хочет развееться за игрой, отдохнуть от насущего.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133251638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1638879211}
review:
If you're an old-head like me, you might remember what it was like to go the the local shop or arcade on a Saturday afternoon so you could pump a few quarters into the Pac-Man/Donkey Kong/Asteroids/whatever machine.  Remember that feeling?  Well, this game will bring some of that back.  

It's reminiscent of a cross between the original arcade Gauntlet and the NES version of Final Fantasy.  Like those games, it's remarkably easy to pick up and learn on the fly.  If you're looking for a game that will tax your skills, this isn't it.  But, if you're looking to play a game just to kill some time and recapture that feeling of having no particular place to be on a Saturday afternoon, this will do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995712807', 'num_games_owned': 616, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1427766698}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985132289', 'num_games_owned': 2621, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1411634416}
review:
This game is absolutely terrible, arbitrary, and no fun to play whatsoever. It attempts to emulate the success of Dungeons of Dredmor, but lacks anything resembling its staying power in terms of gameplay and entertainment.

In short, if you want a roguelike that's actually decent, get Dungeons of Dredmor when it's on sale. It's superior in every way to this lackluster ten-cent title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085482037', 'num_games_owned': 1442, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1416097594}
review: yes very fun can be easyly hacked good characters, blanced (somewhat)

author: {'steamid': '76561197983612841', 'num_games_owned': 475, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1411459451}
review:
Довольно приятная игрушка за свою цену. Проста, как тут было уже сказано: ее можно раскладывать не спеша словно пасьянс. Лично мне это в ней и нравится - не нужно напрягать различные части тела во время игры. Таким образом она успешно выполняет роль убийцы времени, когда нечем заняться. При этом на фоне играет приятная музычка.
Еще не оценил все классы (их в игре 4), поэтому про баланс сказать не могу ничего.
Из недостатков пока заметил только не совсем удачную генерацию уровней: могут попасться запертые двери на начальном этаже, а ключ, если повезет, найдется только на, скажем, четвертом, и возвращаться на первый ради этой двери уже нет никакого смысла, только чисто для самоудовлетворения, что мол, я полностью зачистил уровень.
Безусловно, есть похожие игры с более захватывающими геймплеем, но и стоят они уже дороже.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093855067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 120, 'last_played': 1411204141}
review: Одна из тех игр где не следует придумовать всякие стратегии (только изредко или если режим сложности настолько...ну вы меня поймётте) а просто наслаждаться игрой.Геймплей простой и удобный-через 10 минут привыкнете.Лично для меня в игре было очень удивительно услышать столь подходящую музыку к уровням.Лично для новичков могу сказать что игра легко и быстро изучаеться и где-то через минут 20-30-вуаля!Но нащёт покупки игры я скажу вам-если есть деньги лишнии-можете купить, так как игра по своему интересна, но если денег совсем жим-жим то лучше нестоит,я бы не покупал(я лично купил с помощью купона со скидкой).Но в своем жанре игра просто божит-увлекательная игруха за какието 3 доллара (у меня цены в долларах поетому я незнаю скоко в рублях) и гдето на 3-4 дня геймлея обезпечены, потом к сожелению начинает надоидать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044662948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1410847676}
review: Quest of Dungeons has an engaging design, great artwork, great music, a dash of humor, a clever combat, and addictive gameplay.  All of this will only cost you five dollars.  Of course I recommend this!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023639801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 838, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1581853282}
review:
This game is quite charming and fun in its simplistic design. The different classes and skills also add a good amount of depth and replay capability to the game as well.

Combat can get somewhat tedious at times, but not nearly enough to cripple the gameplay.

It took me 1 hour and 45 minutes to complete the game on Hard mode so take that into consideration when purchasing.

Overall I would give this game a solid 8/10, making it well worth its $5 price tag

author: {'steamid': '76561198148184948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1410578096}
review:
I was able to get this game for 50% off with a coupon from completing a badge set.  For $2.50, I have really enjoyed this game which is a modern making of a old school dungeon crawler.

The graphics are 16-Bit and the music creates a nice ambiance.  The game play is simple, kill mosters, explore dungeons, find some loot, get better gear and skills, and go down to the next dungeon.  Nothing complicated at all. The game doesn't take itself seriously and it the humor throughout the game adds a nice flavor.  My favorite taunt from the monsters is "The cake is a lie!"

Just be warned, this is old school style.  I was exploring the last dungeon before I went up against the final boss when a mage froze me.  While I was frozen, a monster attacked me while the mage kept hitting me with spells.  I died and death is permanent in this game.  I've got to start all over now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047398357', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1410159673}
review:
This game is boring, uninspired, and poorly thought out. I get it, it's a rogue-like/retro/classic RPG with a snarky attitude. It's also just plain bad. The original "Rogue" and its character based followers are superior to this game in every respect. But I'm not going to try to wax poetic about why this game stinks. Let me just give a clear list of points that illustrate, very plainly, why this game is deeply flawed.

1. You and everything else have the same move speed. That means that you each move (or preform one action such as attack, open door, drink potion, etc) per turn. The problem with this system is that when you are facing a fight you know, mathematically speaking, you cannot win, you may as well just restart the game then and there. Why? Because you aren't going to be able to out damage what you're fighting and you cannot run away either. Because everything else has the same movement speed, anything that you fight will follow one space behind you... forever. They will chase you through the entire dungeon, always one space behind you (did I mention there is no actual animation in this game either. Just sprites moving along in linear motions along a grid? Yeah. Even NES RPGs had some semblance of animation, but not this "retro" release. But I digress) and when you stop, guess what? You're gonna get hit and die. 

2. Health and Mana slowly regenerate on a per turn basis. What this means is that after you've cleared a room, you can just spam WASD (moving one space=one turn) and pace around for a little while, to get your health back. It will regenerate to full, if you are patient enough. It doesn't take long enough to be a great nuisance to do, but it's not so quick either that it's not annoying. The main issue with this though is that it completely makes the inventory system, complete with food, health and mana potions, totally useless. You don't need to drink or eat anything because you'll always just be able regain health and energy after you've completed a room. As for actually using the potions and such in combat? That too isn't really practical because anything that you're fighting that you'd need to drink a potion for is going to kick your ass regaurdless of how much you drink. That's the biggest problem in this game. You're either gauranteed success or failure the moment you walk into a room. Either way it's just as boring.

3. The actual combat is really boring. For the wizard you're always going to be better off using your spells but your mana runs out. But, again, that doesn't really matter because you can just walk around for about a hundred turns (so about 20 seconds) to get all the mana and health you lost back. The knight is just awful. All you can do is hit stuff and then let it hit you, walk around, get back health, repeat.

I think I've made my points very clear. There are still a few bugbears though. For example, there are bear traps scattered throughout some of the rooms. Why? No reason. The player can easily avoid them, the enemies can't knock the player into them nor can the player use them to his advantage. Why are they there? No clue, but it's just a little aspect that really shows how little thought, effort, play testing, and just plain common sense went into this game.

This is an absolutely boring, cliched, uninspired game that still somehow thinks it has the right to mock the player on death (such as flashing "Seriously?" and "Let's just pretend this never happened" in red when the player dies) and ask "leaving so soon" when trying to quit the game. Yes, I am leaving and I will not be returning. If this were just a little flash game on Newgrounds or whatever, I'd take it as a budding game maker spreading his wings and getting his barings in. But charging actual money, no matter how little, is rediculous. Take those couple of bucks this game costs, go to a McDonalds, and get something to eat off the dollar menu. Trust me, that alone will give you far more joy and satisfaction than this game ever could.

1/5, the only redeeming value is that the music is not totally shit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025566002', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1673403032}

author: {'steamid': '76561198052377216', 'num_games_owned': 5706, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1422677919}
review:
It's cute, and precisely what you'd expect for the price. What it lacks is balance, in that you'll be cruising along in auto-pilot until a virtually unbeatable boss appears out of nowhere and either forces you to flee, or eats you alive. In addition, because of the nature of combat, and the fact that all creatures (including the hero) share the same walking speed, there really doesn't exist any room for a third option.

While I certainly give this game a thumbs up for its sound execution of a simple concept, the concept itself is somewhat flawed. It's an excellent purchase if you're able to pick it up for a dollar or so, but it's certainly not worth the default price tag of $5.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051061978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 759, 'last_played': 1477047066}
review:
Quest of Dungeons is a fun rogue-like game that is available on several platforms. It is developed and distributed by David Amador. He’s a kind and friendly guy; feel free to go check him out on Twitter!  https://twitter.com/DJ_Link


30 Second Review

+ Rouge-like permadeath

+ New dungeon every time you play

+ Turn-based tactical strategy

- Almost a nonexistent story

- Hero skill sets are randomized

Click the link below to read the full review:
http://everydaygamers.com/2014/08/25/review-quest-of-dungeons/#more-29611

author: {'steamid': '76561198048075222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1408836254}
review:
This game is pretty cute, it has all the aesthetic appeal necessary to get you into a game of this type, the whole 'Perma-Death' thing might turn a few people away, but it really isn't meant to be played for long hours unless you want it to.

It's cute and humourous but also pretty daunting, once you start the game you'll instantly feel lost, unaware of all the controls and options etc. but you can and will learn these pretty fast on your own, it's more the gloomy vibe of the layout that will get to you. You're actually a little scared to see what you might come up against, you have no idea how strong you are in comparison to the monsters you know are there but are yet to see. 
No idea what any of your stats mean or what any items do that you may have been fortunate enough to find early on, there are interesting looking tiles and things everywhere so here is the biggest thing you'll be doing off the bat CLICK EVERYTHING that looks at all different from the normal tile you see. 
In fact in the very first room there's a signpost you might want to click on and check out... :3
Since that's such a large part of the games experience (IMO) I won't say much more but, go everywhere check everything and be careful! You're sure to enjoy it regardless c:

[Design changes I'd like to see]
I love this game, but there are some things design wise that I think should be improved. You should be able to move your items around in your inventory at will imo since there are so many items that need to be sold at points, organising this would be majorly helpful. I also think that entrances to new rooms on the map should be marked as a different colour since its quite easy to miss if you aren't looking at it every 5 seconds. Only once you're looking back over a floor do you suddenly see you may have missed or forgotten about a few rooms.
Also I'm sorry but I have to question why you're only allowed one save file... What if I want one file per class/character? Can you not give us at least 4 slots? I don't want to have to come on and commit to one class every time and only be able to change it once I die :C
And what about a 'graveyard' of sorts, or a 'hero's plaque' where you can choose to record your past characters exploits after death ^^

Final Thoughts:
I don't know if anymore will be added to the game but I'd certainly buy DLC if it were available X3, maybe I'm a sucker, but Pokemon Mystery Dungeon is like the same genre, and I was 100% addicted to it AND it's sequels, if there were more content in this... well [i]I[/i] would love it at least <3 

9/10-MeGN ''It's decent''
8/8-MeSpot ''Not perfect, but as close as any human can get''
2/10-MeCritic ''We loved it!''

author: {'steamid': '76561197979751082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 660, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1511252391}
review: I absolutley love this game. It is a rogue like. I don't know how to explain it. The game mechanics have been explained before. You can see from the video how it works etc. I have to tell you, I have been gaming for many years. I have hundreds of games. I generally spend more time reading about and collecting games, than playing. This game has captured my attention. I tend to torrent games, but always buy them if I play and/or like them. I read about this game and torrented it. I played it for a few minutes and bought the game on steam AND IOS. I have spent hours on my ipad playing this game. I have gotten very far and lost it all, again and again, the thing is I instantly want to start again. (this game has perma death BTW.) Not only do I recomennd buying this game, I say buy it on steam AND IOS. I finally have an app on my ipad that make me drain the batteries. I love love love this game. I also play this on steam. If you don't have an IOS device, get it on steam for sure. Like I said before, but it on both, you wont be disapointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071667268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1900, 'last_played': 1408984527}
review: Bon voila après avoir passé pas mal d'heure à tuer du pixel, que dire de ce Quest of dungeons....Qu'il s'agit d'un bon rogue like, certe plutot classique, mais dont les mechaniques de jeux font recettes. Ici pas d'arbres de compétences compliqué, ni de menus à ralonge, non on se trouve en face d'un rogue minimaliste qui fait la part belle à l'action. 4 classes de perso, un marchand par étage, des boss, des objets pour améliorer la puissance de son guerrier....Et un gros balèze à dézinguer afin de voir la petite fin bien sympa....tout est résumé ici. Pourtant malgrè le peu d'inovation du titre, les parties s'enchainenent sans aucun temps mort ni lassitude, la preuve sans aucun doute que l'on a affaire ici à un jeu solide et accrcheur. Et comme dirait l'autre "c'est dans la simplicité que tu trouvera le bonheur". A essayer donc pour tout amateur de rogue à l'ancienne...une histoire d'amour et de souffrance...

review: This game is pretty great. The movement isn't bad (you can use wasd or click to move), although picking up a bunch of items from chests does get pretty annoying. Overall though, its a good game. I do dislike how there isn't many classes to choose from.. and there's only (technically) one ranged character, the Archer. And, the amount of floors in the game isn't what I expected it to be. Worth the 5 bucks though.

review: This is by far the easiest and most simplistic rogue-like game I ever played. There's no crafting of any kind and very little skill in actually required to finish this game. The Boss music is pretty good at least. All the items in the game are pretty much just there to be sold for gold. Upon further research I found out that the game was ported from Android and was primarily designed for that platform. Don't waste your time rogue like fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036654045', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1406651700}
review:
Quest of Dungeons is arguably the most intense horror game I have ever experienced. Every floor presents hidden dangers that will keep you short of breath and the hairs on your arms standing. Every new encounter is as terrifying as the last, bombarding you with grotesque mutations, horrifying imagery, and creatures that you could only have nightmares about.

The fear hits you from the first moment that you enter the game. With no exit in sight, you are immediately thrown into what you can only imagine to be an inescapable demise. What hit me the hardest, however, was the bone-chilling dialogue of your various hunters. I couldn't tell you the last time that I had a good night's sleep.

Would not recommend this game to anyone with past history of cardiac irregularities, asthma attacks, stroke, unexplainable twitching, abusive spouses, poor math grades, or whining like a bitch.

10/10 it's okay

review: This game was a big surprise for me after a few hours of gameplay. Loved the sounds, the music, the simple graphics and the gameplay which is simple, smooth and challenging. I absolutely loved the references from other games/movies. If you love dungeons, challenges and pixels, buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060060059', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1406897629}
review:
I can't really say this is a bad game, but I can't say I like it either. I feel that it lacks any real character of its own; the random qoutes that the enemies say are mostly well placed, but some of them don't fit into the game at all. I found the 'The princess is in another dungeon' qoute laughable, but something like 'you should have taken the blue pill' didn't make sense. I know what it's from, but how does that coincide with this game?

Another big thing was, no matter how I went about it, I was always killed by something rather stupid. Being hit by a status effect I didn't even know was on me, or be it that stupid sign at the first floor, these deathes were unjustified.

If this game were to change these sort of things, and scale things better, so I don't run into over powered quest bosses on the second floor, then I'd certainly reccomend this, but as it is, I wouldn't reccomend it to any of my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067947561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1406757932}
review:
Demasiado bueno. En un principio me chocó el permadeath y la interfaz en sí, pero luego de unos minutos se logra entender a la perfección, lograndole sacar el provecho a la dinámica del juego. Si bien mi lado va más por los Jrpg, no he encontrado impedimento (a excepción, como ya dije, de los primeros minutos de juego) para disfrutarlo a full. Muy recomendado para los amantes de juegos retros y action rpg, ya que si bien este juego es "por turnos", esto casi ni se nota. 
Muy ágil, dinámico, interfaz entendible en pocos minutos (aun cuando nunca se haya jugado nada del género) y entretenido para estar horas recorriendo los dungeons en busca de items o subiendo nivel. 
Ojo con el HP, que no llegue a CERO!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027462732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1405866810}
review: Bin von dem Spiel leider sehr enttäuscht. Niedlich ist es ja, und das Handling sowie die Fähigkeiten und Dungeons super gemacht. Mich nervt nur, dass ich nach mehreren Stunden Spielen nicht tiefer als Ebene 5 gekommen bin. Man muss stets neu anfangen, wenn man von einem Monster attackiert wurde und gestorben ist. Ich finde, an den Anfang der Ebene gesetzt zu werden, wo man gestorben ist, hätte es auch getan - vor allem im Spielmodus "easy". Ich habe im Internet und bei Steam nach Tipps geschaut und alle beherzigt. Irgendwann öffnete ich - bestens ausgerüstet - eine Tür. In diesem Raum befand sich eine Hexe, die noch nicht mal ein Boss war. Diese hat mich mit einem Schlag getötet. Meiner Ansicht nach ist der Assassine der beste Charakter, aber selbst mit ihm lebt man nicht sehr lange. Also, Finger weg von diesem Spiel, wenn man Erfolge sehen will. Wer gaaaaanz viel zeit übrig hat und gern immer und immer und immer wieder ein Spiel neu beginnt, der kann es sich ruhig holen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993466238', 'num_games_owned': 721, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1699101409}
review: I've played a lot of roguelikes, this is one of the best. It's easy to pick up and play, it's got a good pace, lots of loot, you can sell off excess stuff when you find a vendor, learn spells easily and actually have a chance to get to the end. I thoroughly recommend this one!

author: {'steamid': '76561198039631909', 'num_games_owned': 1369, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1413735856}
review:
感觉上这是一款比较舒适的小品级roguelike，虽然画面不大有特色，但BGM颇为动听，商店里的那首让我直接产生了找OST的冲动。
游戏模式和其他的地城roguelike大同小异，技能栏只有一格的设定让我有些捉摸不透作者的用心，既然可以在技能书里选为什么不弄多几个快捷栏呢。
可选择的职业数是中规中矩的四个（战士、法师、弓手、萨满），由于只玩过弓手就暂且不作评测。
就目前的体验而言游戏内容只有简单的刷刷刷卖卖卖，偶尔再做几个杀BOSS或找东西的任务，也算能基本满足消闲的需求了。
在中等难度下清了前两层成了土豪并各种物品溢出，面对着包里只能卖钱的各色石头和无法叠加的多种食物，我总感觉会出现锻造和烹饪系统，不知是玩得太浅没遇到还是尚未做进去，期待后续的更新能带来更多内容吧。
当初因为这个游戏而入了一整个慈善包，粗略玩耍过后也并未感到期待落空，如果你也是roguelike爱好者的话，在该游戏入包或是打折的情况下还是可以入来玩的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198041987032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1416, 'last_played': 1405516980}
review:

On voudrait juste plus de niveaux ou un mode "survie".

author: {'steamid': '76561198018893258', 'num_games_owned': 3719, 'num_reviews': 744, 'playtime_forever': 3589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3343, 'last_played': 1537969706}
review:
カジュアルローグライク。
4つのクラスから1人を選んで、世界から光を奪ったダークロードを倒しにいく。
ダンジョン階層は7層、ナナメ移動が無ければ、近接のナナメ攻撃もなく、空腹ステータスもないシンプル構造。ローグライク経験者なら物足りなさを感じるだろう。

基本的には金色の宝箱から手に入るアイテムで装備的に金銭的にかなり楽になる。ボスはスキルを上手く使いポーション回復でゴリ押しできるが、倒すメリットが薄いため無理して戦うことはない。よって金色の宝箱が置いてある部屋の鍵とポーションは重要。クエストにしても、討伐クエストは不意の死亡率をあげる要因になることから受けない方がいい。金策のためなら別だが。アイテムについては付加効果の影響が予想以上に大きいためよく見て装備を整えること。

また、途中で出てくる盗賊系の敵は倒しても盗品が戻ってこない。[strike]しかもアイテムのスタックまとめて盗んでくる鬼畜な仕様だ。[/strike]さらに後半の魔法を使う敵にはもっと注意が必要だ。難易度ノーマルまでなら問題はないがハード以上は即死する可能性がある。特に敵のスタンを食らうとアイテム使用や回復も出来ずに一方的に攻撃を食らい死ぬことがある。運がないと回避できないので理不尽だと言わざるをえない。敵を見かけたら即殺するしか手がないためなんらかの回避方法が欲しかった。

[Ver 2.0 アップデート]
新しいダンジョンとボス、クラスが追加された。"NecroDancer"とのコラボにより"Cadence"を操作できるようになった。キャラの特徴としては器用貧乏キャラで他のクラスよりもスキルを上手く使うことが必要だ。追加要素だけでなくバランスも調整されている。

全体的に見れば、上記の敵の魔法攻撃についての不満があるものの、ゲームについての前提知識が多くなく手軽に何度でもプレイしたくなるシンプルさの良いゲームだ。

author: {'steamid': '76561198097648329', 'num_games_owned': 686, 'num_reviews': 364, 'playtime_forever': 1339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 879, 'last_played': 1430198257}
review:
턴제 로그라이크 게임입니다.

게임자체가 그럴듯한 스토리가 있는 것이 아닌데 퀘스트 오브 던전 타이틀에 비해

퀘스트가 평이하고 큰 의미가 없습니다.

인터페이스가 불편하고 직업 간 밸런스가 썩 좋지 못합니다.

모바일 게임 수준의 완성도로 비슷한 스타일의 게임 중에서도 딱히 개성이라고 찾아볼 만한 게 없습니다.

2015년 2월 17일 평가 수정 중인 현재 스팀 클라우드 지원 표기 되어있지만

정작 게임 세이브 데이터 지원 안 합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015830053', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 766, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1436484068}
review: I was searching for a game to satisfy a certain urge, the urge for something refreshing and new; but yet with a nostalgic flare. I stumbled upon this game and decided to give it a shot for 5 bucks. Let me just say right now... WORTH IT. I spent nearly 2 hours straight playing it after I finished the 2 minute installation. The fight mechanics are pretty good, if not a little over-reactive with the mouse controls (I sometimes end up unintentionally moving when I click a tile with a monster on it as an assassin) but for 5 bucks it's certainly not a bother to me. This game is really well done for the price in my opinion, and I certainly hope this becomes popular. I imagine this as almost a turn based Binding of Isaac, with equipment you can switch out as opposed to just stacking more on or overwriting it accidentally. Having multiple classes is also a plus, though I have only played the assassin. My point is, if you have 5 bucks in your steam wallet thats burning a hole in your pocket; give this game a chance because you just may fall in love with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019639706', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1443233692}
review:
Okay, so after playing around for a few hours, here's what I think.
Gameplay? Addictive, simple, rewarding, easy to streamline into faster paced dungeon delving
Story? Who needs it?
Personal Opinion? Working towards a powerful character with all abilities/spells feels great. It also provides a real sense of loss when you die and have to start all over again, though the game is simple enough that it won't take too long. So far I've not made it past the 4th floor, so restarting may not be as bad yet as, say, dying on the 10th floor (if it even goes that far).
Pro Tips
- keep everything with you until you find a merchant. All that bad gear you keep finding? Sell it. You can easily make 20K gold if you sell as much stuff as you can.
- once you have lots of gold, always buy keys from the merchants. You never know when you'll need them.
